Reviews.Title: “Close to El Yunque & Fajardo”
Reviews.Author: DawnDuBois
Reviews.Content: We stayed a cpl nights! It was soooo quiet and peaceful. Had to figure out airconditioner and having on the ceiling fan above the bed was great to blow down the AC. Love the open air roof top dining area. Nice place to enjoy the delicious free brkfst while writing postcards :-) . The hotel staff were very friendly and informative and speak excellent english.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent get away from everything”
Reviews.Author: rocymd
Reviews.Content: We wanted to escape from everything and try some new place so we went to Luquillo and it was totally worth it. Te place is clean, the personel friendly and kind. The room was spacious for two with a nice private balcony. The beaches of the area are clean and are safe with lifeguards. You can rent beach chairs, beach umbrellas and even moories. The breakfast were delicious. We are planning to go back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy,comfortable & Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Grantraddicals
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days at Luquillo and this hotel is worth every single penny! The rooms are clean and comfortable and the beach is beautiful and right across the street. Its a small place, clean and basic but the kindness shown from the staff in the way they treat you makes you feel like you are at the Ritz! Maria & Sherry at the front desk are super friendly and helpful and Katie in the kitchen is the BEST!! Breakfast was delicious and ready for you every morning. Our trip in PR had its bumps but the Luquillo Sunrise Inn was definitely part of the highlights that made it sparkle! Thanks Luquillo Inn!! We definitely would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good family place - well run - nice people - great views”
Reviews.Author: CaptDavey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice, once for 2 days and later for a day. The rooms were basic, but very clean and quite acceptable and quiet, with a nice balcony looking at the Atlantic, just across the small street.. Good value. The hotel staff was great -- very pleasant and very helpful in many ways. Good base for sightseeing. The covered veranda breakfast was a nice way to meet and talk to the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: riverrat09
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the Inn and had a great time as always.Thanks to Marsha, Gary, Mario, Maria, Sherry, Alejandra and the entire staff. We were lucky to get a room on the third floor where the view is great and you don't need A/C. Keep the doors open for a nice breeze.The sound of the waves crashing ashore makes for sound sleeping.Breakfast on the terrace was plentiful, with something for everyone. The staff just can't do enough for you. I had a slight dental problem and they went out of their way to accommodate me. A great feature was the waffle maker on the buffet where you could make your own waffles.There are several good restaurants within walking distance.Miramar on the Plaza, Guava's, Boardriders and of course, Pasta y Pueblo. We also enjoyed the Brass Cactus which has nightly specials. If you stay there, a car is advisable. There are great places to visit in the area. Even San Juan is only a 45 minute ride away. There is just so much to explore in the area, or spend a quiet day on the beach. Playa Azul around the point is calm and excellent for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn”
Reviews.Author: Al168Trenton_NJ
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff were both knowleageable and extremely friendly. We spent six nights and wish we could spend more. One suggestion is that Luquillo is not for those who are hoping to be busy all day long during your vacation. This is a sleepy little town perfect for those who want to kick back and relax.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Place to Stay Near the Rainforest”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaBeachRandR
Reviews.Content: First time visit to Puerto Rico heading toward Luquillo and accidentally ran into this sweet little place. No reservations but managed to get the last room we stayed 2 nights. Comfort and awesome breakfast. Service is beyond any resort in San Juan and better overall quaint place. Local food is awesome walked to some local restaurants (and yes its safe) be adventurist and think outside the box along the way you get the real music, people, and culture overall along the streets. We will be back if and when we can. Thanks from the people in VA!!! We stayed March 3 & 4 in Room 45 with beautiful ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, gorgeous location, great service and fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: spikemaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #34...third floor, extended balcony with a king bed and perfect view of the surf framed by palm trees. When we arrived tired after a long trip, we were warmly greeted by Mario who offered us inexpensive beer, wine and soda to enjoy right away. He gave us a map of the area and recommended restaurants, stores and places to see - each of which was spot on. The breakfast was absolutely delicious and a great way to start each day. The location was a perfect home base for visiting the beach and El Yunque (rainforest). Mario and Maria made trip reservations for us to visit Bio Bay which was a great little side trip just 20-30 minute drive. I typically suffer from pretty severe insomnia, but for some reason slept a full 8 hours/night while staying at the Sunrise - that place is nothing short of magical! Everywhere we went people people exclaimed that "Mario and Maria at the Luquillo Sunrise are good people" and we couldn't agree more. Great property and warm welcome at a great price - you can't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Linnea M
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and extremely friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast on the patio was delicious and we had a great view of the sea from our balcony. The beds were a little uncomfortable however, and the decoration in the rooms needs some updating. Otherwise a delightful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, good location”
Reviews.Author: treddd
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but comfortable rooms with a good view of the beach, friendly service, great location (good base to explore the superior beaches of Luquillo) . Was exactly how I expected a 3starred hotel in a relatively sleepy Beach town to be run.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back town and beach”
Reviews.Author: LWoolston
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a disco until 2 am. DO expect the streets to be rolled up during the week (especially off-season) by 11 pm. Several decent restaurants within walking distance, but breakfast is definitely at the hotel. As other state, rooms are basic, staff great, beach exceptional. You do need a car. We found that most guests were driving the island and staying several nights in a variety of places. They made a good choice for this hotel. We stayed a week and were perfectly content.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunrises!”
Reviews.Author: AMF2224
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Resort. Nothing fancy but clean and great service. The staff is awesome and was very helpful in giving us directions as we made our way around PR. A number of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The beach across the street from of the hotel is busy on weekends with families and surfers. The Luquillo Beach Kiosks is a must see if you are in the area; #12 Jefe's Burger Shack has the BEST Limon Ginger Mojitos I haev every tasted - be sure to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: MarnieNJ
Reviews.Content: Very basic but extremely clean and well staffed. Location is great - right on the surfing beach and walkable to other calmer beaches. The staff was more helpful than any other place we've been - they had recommendations that were perfect and booked all of our excursions. There are so many good places to eat nearby - very unpretentious and laid back town. We had a great time and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis at the sea”
Reviews.Author: winterpegger_10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Friendly/helpful staff. Spent a week, using Sunrise as a base to go exploring. It was very windy with large surf, so for beach time we walked to a calmer area around the point. There are also many beaches within short driving distance. The hotel is pretty basic but well kept-up and very clean (our most important criteria anywhere we go!). Good sized rooms, comfy bed, with compact fridge and microwave (but no dishes or cutlery!). The overhead fan and open patio door cooled us sufficiently that we didn't even use the a/c; that way we could be lulled to sleep by the crashing surf. The included breakfast was always excellent; hot/cold cereals, toast, pastry, hot breakfast entree, juice, coffee, milk, fresh fruit served by charming and friendly staff, eaten on a sunbathed patio overlooking the ocean. The neighborhood is a mix of maintained and dilapidated buildings. We didn't have any negative experience with respect to safety.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small sea-side town, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristaTheNetherlands
Reviews.Content: You should really visito Luquillo during your stay at Puerto Rico. Easy going small sea-side town. Het Public Beach, near the friteria's is the place to at at Sunday afternoon. Just go there, and take a look at the locals at and near the beach. Friendly and safe to go and have fun. The kioks make dinner easy all you can eat for less than 10 dollars. Walk around, admire the cars and music, jet-ski or have a drink. Excellent place to go, specially in the weekends. Hotel is perfect: welcome to paradise! At the beach, you hear the waves in your room, excellen service, very clean and breakfast at the beach. What's more to whish for? Don't miss Luquilo and the Sunrise Beach Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: sunnytraveler_9
Reviews.Content: The room and view of the ocean are really nice, and the included breakfast was good. The beach in front of the hotel has rough surf and isn't for swimming, but you can walk to a calmer beach, but be careful of rocks in the shallow water. luquillo beach would be a long walk along the water, but is about a 5 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OhioIrish
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a five night stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. We were in room 24 - with king bed, extended balcony, microwave, small refrigerator, and wifi service. Outstanding service is what makes the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn so special. Every staff member was friendly and helpful - with directions, suggestions for activities and locations to visit, assistance with printing boarding passes, etc. As mentioned in other reviews, the breakfast is great - plentiful and fresh. Each of our five mornings featured a different hot entree. Beach towels and chairs are available free of additional charge each day. Location is perfect. We used Luquillo as a base to explore a variety of water activities - time at several beaches, snorkeling, sailing, kayaking, and diving. We also visited El Yunque. Old San Juan was included in our three days there prior to traveling to Luquillo. There are several good restaurants within a two block radius of the inn as well. But the very best part was the view off the balcony of the ocean and listening to the tree frogs "sing" each night. Yes, the area surrounding the inn has some vacated properties, but every person we encountered in the community was friendly and helpful. We did not want one of those all inclusive, programmed vacation resorts. Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was exactly what we wanted and more! We will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hosts and breakfast were great!”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The rooms were clean, but if you're into chic decor, this's isn't the place for you. Being right across the street from the ocean was great - we coud hear the waves from our beds. TV left something to be desired, but who watches TV on vacation? Maria was a fabulous host and was very hospitable. The breakfast was our favorite part - freshest fruit we ate in all of Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto”
Reviews.Author: sara1213
Reviews.Content: I was going to go on about all the good things at Luquillo Sunrise and can't say it any better than the other folks that were here in Jan 2012 with us! The pasta restaurant was wonderful and a unique PR experience. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable about things to do in the area. The street between the Inn and the beach has very little traffic and we never had any trouble getting across to enjoy it. There is a noise ordinance in Luquillo and the police are very responsive to any problems. Our only problem was another set of inn guests that were loud and obnoxious after 10PM and they quit after my husband let them know it was an issue. Breakfast was delicious and varied each day- lots of fresh fruit, oatmeal and pastries besides the hot entree of the day. If I had to complain about something, the beds could be better but we were so tired , we still slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Good but over priced.”
Reviews.Author: badfx
Reviews.Content: Really good welcoming and helpful staff. The area feels run down and is a bit shabby. I found the whole of puerto rico overpriced. You just dont get value for mzoney on this island. The restaurants are not very good in luquillo so you are better off going to the food stalld just off the high way (you will know where I mean when you pass them). The hotel itself is ok but just worth the tariff, I would probably stay in old san juan if I went to puerto rico again, but i wont as I ain't that rich.

Reviews.Title: “As good as reviews”
Reviews.Author: bill07901
Reviews.Content: Very good to excellent in all respects. Fantastic staff. Surprisingly good food in walking distance. Nitpicking, windy, could use screens on sliding doors and better pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Got What We Paid For and More”
Reviews.Author: marcieh926
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to El Yunque Rain Forrest that wasnâ€™t too pricey and this was one of the 2 options that popped up. The room was adequate and clean with cable TV and a hot shower and included breakfast. The hotel was across the street from the beach, where surfing and water sports were available. There was a nice public terrace on the second floor that overlooked the ocean. Breakfast was included which was again adequate. The staff was very nice and friendly. They gave us a free beach towel to take to El Yunque. Next door was a restaurant â€œshackâ€� that turned out to be one of the best gourmet meals we had eaten in the 3 weeks we stayed in PR. Not really a drawback but the hotel is located in a residential community that most US travelers would find lower income. There was a skate park in front of the hotel where the local boys hung out and people BBQing on the beach across from the hotel. We felt safe there but the usual cautions of traveling in PR should be observed.

Reviews.Title: “Best of PR tour”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited 3 different hotels on PR the 1st week of Jan. One was a high priced B&B in San Juan, then a luxury resort in Fajardo, then this one. Each was a different experience, but overall we enjoyed this one the most. The surf in front of the hotel has a very strong undertow and large waves. If you are an experienced surfer or boogie-boarder, you may be in heaven. My bf and I are used to the New England beaches and loved to play in the waves then lie out in the sun there, but I wouldn't let kids in that particular beach. There are calmer beaches for kids within a very short drive, so I would still recommend the hotel overall to families. The staff is very friendly. The free use of beach chairs and towels was a great amenity. We used them every day. The gated parking was also a plus. I wouldn't walk around the neighborhood at night, mostly because not all the locals seem to like tourists, but driving out to restaurants then back into the gate was fine. We washed clothes at the local laundry-mat, and the owners there were also friendly. The hotel staff is great at giving directions to attractions and restaurants. There are a handful of nice neighborhood places to eat. This is a nice central location to both the rain forest and the ferry and beaches of Fajardo as well as Loquillo. Personally, I would skip the food kiosks one exit down on the public beach - some of the locals there seem to hate white folks. One restaurant actually turned their back on us and refused to serve us, but if you speak spanish you may fare better there. There was a fridge and microwave in our room and a grocery store within a 2-3 min drive. That was a nice combo if you're looking to save money a few nights by eating on the balcony at the inn, watching the waves crash on the beach. My only complaint was that the bed was uncomfortable. We had one of the best rooms in the place - a king with an oceanfront balcony. The bed seemed like an older mattress which was supported by a wooden platform (no springs to be found). The sheets and blankets are also lower quality polyester blend, low thread count. Neither one of us could sleep well, and I found myself missing the soft squishy beds with softer sheets at the previous resort. The breakfast was average on our three mornings, and it seems that it's hard for them to time the hot entree for many guests, so you may have to wait 15-30 mins if you want that. There is plenty of bagels, pastry, coffee, oatmeal, fruit, etc.. set out if you are on the run. Overall, I would recommend this place. We had a great time, and would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up to the sound of crashing waves”
Reviews.Author: BBoopL
Reviews.Content: This is truly a little gem in Puerto Rico, and is best as a launch site for all the great eastern PR destinations like Fajardo, Vieques, El Yunque Rainforest, etc. It is like a Motel and a Bed and Breakfast rolled into one. The staff is small but so friendly and truly dedicated to being helpful on your trip - it was like having friends on the island to guide you to where to go and what to do. It is a bare-bones type of inn, but they provide such personal touches like the communal style breakfast every morning and giving you all the beach towels and beach chairs you want. They'll even rent you a boogie board. We thought we may need a tour guide for El Yunque rain forest but after Mario, one of their stellar staff members, gave us a detailed map and hand wrote in all the instructions on where to drive to and where to stop and what trails to take, we realized Mario was the best tour guide around - and he didn't even have to accomany us! The view from their "ocean view" rooms is SPECTACULAR. We would highly recommend getting one of those rooms. You fall asleep and wake up to the sound of crashing waves. The beach right across the inn is perfect for surfing, and from our balcony we sat and watched all the surfers do their thing. Rooms are clean with a decent size fridge and a microwave. The bathroom showers even have one of those built-in soap dispensers with shampoo and body gel. Unfortunately the bed and pillows were a bit uncomfortable (feels like they had plastic wrap under them). A five minute drive from the inn is a quarter mile row of lots of kiosks and food stands that are great to explore. There is also a movie theater (Caribbean Cinema) 5 minutes away as well which we took avantage of one night when it was raining. Lovely place and we'd certainly come back to stay here again on our next PR adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Like something out of a TV commercial..”
Reviews.Author: ChalantSavant
Reviews.Content: All I can say is wow. What a great location. It seems a neighboring hotel has lower rates, but I doubt their service or breakfast can match-up. This hotel is secure and has good accommodations. The only complaint I have, is that the Internet for the public computer is very poor -- which is disappointing if you want to print your boarding passes. Otherwise, no real complaints. They even offer beach towels, chairs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: bertsirkin
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. We had a Deluxe-King room. The room had an oversized balcony (room 34) on the 3rd floor - which is the only downside, if you have a lot of luggage, as the only way up are the stairs, and there are no "bell persons". But, the 3rd floor was great as it provided the best view of the ocean (plus, you'll need a bit of exercise after their bountiful breakfasts. Breakfast is served on the 2nd floor, and it is bountiful - and VERY good. The office has beach chairs and towels that are loaned free when you go to the beach. There are two beaches: Playa Azul - about a 10-minute walk from the hotel and Luquillo Beach (highly recommended!). The staff is fantastic - willing to make calls, reservations, just about anything you could want. The absolutely best restaurant in the area is immediately next-door - Pasta y Pueblo. And within a very short walking distance was, what became our "hang-out", Boardriders Rum Shack Bar & Grill (http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g635965-d1743702-Reviews-Boardriders_Rum_Shack_Bar_Grilll-Luquillo_Puerto_Rico.html) - a GREAT "beach-bar/restaurant with phenomenal fish tacos. We'll definitely be back next year! P.S., there are two buildings that make up this property - one is immediately in front of the beach, and the other is further back. We stayed in the building with the ocean view. The other building didn't have an ocean view. I'm sure the "back" building is less expensive, so consider what's important to you when booking a room.

Reviews.Title: “Gringo Heaven”
Reviews.Author: OBeeJay
Reviews.Content: For those that want comfort during their stay - look no further. Beach front location, in a relaxing, safe, convenient town. Make a reservation in advance, especially in season. The rooms are good size, clean, with everything you would expect. Onsite gated parking, Breakfast in the morning - ample portions and good food. Great way to start the day. Hot water - Yipee! A/C, Balcony. I got a very good night rest here, even stayed here more than once. In the area there is lots to do, visit the rain forest or the beach or good eats in the neighborhood. The hotel staff is very friendly, there is plenty of information of "what to do" in the area. Or just chill on the balcony or in a hammock listening to the ocean. This is a friendly environment - not a huge stuffy hotel out to leach every last penny from you. Once you try, you will want to stay longer and visit often! Make your reservation today!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AmyOStCharles
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to return. We traveled as a family, two adults and two teens. Everyone had a great time and did not want to leave. This is a great location near restaurants, beach (note - the beach directly in front of the hotel is not a swimming beach), shopping, and PLENTY of great outdoor opportunities. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The weather during our stay in December was a great temperature, mostly sun in the mornings, cloudier in the afternoons and usually a 15 minute mist of rain everyday. We stayed in the green room and I thought it was a great deal for the price. The noises took a little getting used to between the neighbors, coqui frogs etc, but I think that's a puerto rico thing! My favorite part of the trip - kayak to Bio bay through the mangrove! If there is a must-do tour on your list, I would book it before you get there, a couple of the tours available were booked solid before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tim K
Reviews.Content: Over Thanksgiving we took a family trip to Puerto Rico. It was our first visit and we wanted to make sure we stayed somewhere on the beach We found many favorable reviews on the Luquillo Inn so we decided to stay there our first 4 nights in PR. .We stayed in there 3 bedroom apartment as we are a family of 5.The location is near perfect as there in only a road that separates the Inn from the beach. The beach is very nice in this area as well. The surf can get rough, but you can take a short walk and find much calmer water if you so choose. The staff was very friendly and helpful and they did a great job of keeping our room clean. They provide a great breakfast every morning which includes something hot that changes every day and is made to order. The blueberry/banana pancakes were awesome and so was the breakfast sandwich. The only complaint that I have is the mattress and pillows in the master bedroom and were very uncomfortable. The twins beds in the second bedroom were hard as well. I would highly recommend staying at this inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Carrieandkent
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights and were completely thrilled with every aspect of this little hotel. The staff went out of their way to assist us on our excursions. We had a great breakfast on the terrace every morning and everything was fresh. The rooms were very clean and had AC which was a godsend coming from very cold to very humid! The beach in front was a surf beach but a 2 minute walk down the beach brought us to a great swimming and snorkeling beach. the restaurants in the area were great and we had no problem walking home late in the area!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: Penelo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends on our first visit to PR. This inn was perfect for us. At night you can sit on the balcony and listen to the waves roaring on the beach. There is a full breakfast cooked to order in the morning (not for me, I'm vegan, but the were other things, oatmeal, etc.). The location was convenient to Old SJ and El Yunque. The conciergish desk guy was EXTREMELY helpful with scheduling snorkeling and night kayaking. The bioluminescent bay was truly amazing and not to be missed. I highly recommend this sweet beachside inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Jeff T
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at this Inn. The staff is very nice and the Inn is clean and pleasant but. First, we were not expecting the bad neighborhood however the Inn and parking lot are secure. Second, most distressful was that the bed was so uncomfortable we could not stay a second night. This Inn would be fine for twenty somethings or thirty somethings without kids and looking for a place near some nice beaches and who don't mind little inconveniences like being back at the Inn before it gets dark. Otherwise I would recommend going in a group of at least four. If the beds were comfortable we might consider returning, maybe, because the staff is nice and the place is cute and the view from the balcony is great, and the sound of the waves crashing on the beach .... I wish the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki F
Reviews.Content: The Luquillo Sunrise is absolutely perfect. I'm a pretty critical person, and I can't criticize it at all! The staff is wonderful and friendly, and predict all of your needs. We stayed in the Coqui Room, aptly named after the Coqui frogs that we heard all night. That's not a complaint; we loved falling asleep to them! This room doesn't have an ocean view, but when you can literally cross the street and already be on the beach, who needs one?!?! There is also parking in the back right by the Coqui room, so that was awesome as well! The room had a king sized bed as well as a couch and coffee table. There was Dish TV, a fridge, coffee maker, and microwave, large shower, and two sinks. The staff had maps already printed with dining recommendations and snorkel/beach recommendations, and was able to give great directions. They also had plenty of beach towels and boogie boards to use, and snorkel equipment to rent. There is a computer in the lobby area upstairs with internet access; wireless internet reaches some of the rooms, but did not reach to the Coqui Room. Breakfast was awesome! There is a continental breakfast at 7:30, with yummy fruit, pastries, bagels, juice, and coffee. At 8:00, there is a different hot item served everyday such as French toast, breakfast sandwiches, or omelets. This hotel is worth every penny. I could not find a better place if I tried. And, even better, it is literally next door to Pasta y Pueblo. You HAVE to eat there!!! Our friends stayed in an upstairs room with 2 full beds, a balcony, and a beach view. There are no elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: JannaMarie26
Reviews.Content: I only spent 1 night at Luquillo as a base location to the area. The hotel is right across from the Luquillo beach and not far from the Luquillo Kiosks, and a short drive to Fajardo and El Yunque rainforest. The hotel room we stayed in was a basic, no frills room. It was clean, comfortable and a good value. We had a room on the first floor near the office. If I had been staying there longer, I would have preferred a room on one of the upper levels, as there is no view of the beach from the first floor room. This was not a concern for us, but something others may want to consider or ask about before making a reservation. For me, if you are vacation at the beach as long as the room is comfortable and clean... it's perfect. You'll spend most of your day outside at the beach or exploring the area/island. The breakfast is a definite plus and they have a good size parking lot that is secured with an automatic gate. The location right across from the beach is ideal and it is within walking distance of many restaurants and the plaza where you find a convenience store/colmado. The staff is also friendly and willing to make recommendations about what to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VIEWS, BARGAIN, BREAKFAST AND STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney H
Reviews.Content: Southern hospitatlity at its finest! Best staff you could ever ask for to make your stay complete. Free parking, beach chairs, beach towels, free cooler to use...anything you needed, they would make it happen! The breakfast is AMAZING..the special changes every day and all 3 mornings we were there it was fantastic. Maria and her staff were so caring and so knowledable about the area. VIEWS are amazing! Would most defintely reccommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Curlycnj
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our room and the amenities, including beach towels and chairs. The folks were friendly and helpful, the food was excellent. Secure gated parking and easy access to the beach made this a delightful stop. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “You will be treated like family!”
Reviews.Author: mannj511
Reviews.Content: We brought a group to this hotel and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is right across the street from a surfers beach. The sand was clean even though you had to climb a little to get to the beach. The staff at the hotel were warm and friendly. Breakfast was served in an open air balcony with a simple but tasty menu item that changed daily. The hotel staff were very helpful with providing beach equipment, chairs, surf boards etc and even took a group picture of our group and providing each of us a framed picture of our stay there. There is a great restaurant around the corner...open air, small but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Better than excelent”
Reviews.Author: erik n
Reviews.Content: Even though we got there a day after Hurricane Irene, the property was very nice and clean. The breakfasts were wonderful. The service was outstanding. they truly under promised and over delivered. In all of my travels I have never met anybody as willing to help make reservations, suggest restaurants, or plan daily activities as Damien. I would ramble on and on about how helpful he is, but it would be repetitive. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great value, wonderful location, and the friendliest staff on the island!”
Reviews.Author: AHL67
Reviews.Content: We loved this inn! The location is wonderful, right in the surfing beach and a short walk from the calmer public swimming beach. We snorkeled right off the point from the hotel, and although the reefs are somewhat degraded, it was still a fun (and free) way to get some snorkeling in. The staff of the inn is absolutely fantastic--definitely the best part of staying here. We arrived with one more member of our party than planned, and they immediately moved us from the two adjoining rooms we had reserved to a three bedroom apartment in the front of the hotel. The accommodations are not fancy, but they are clean and reasonably spacious. The second story patio is a lovely spot for breakfast, with a view of the ocean! All in all, a fantastic stay, a great value, and some of the nicest people we met on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tugdoug
Reviews.Content: Clean! oh did I say clean! Staff was great and very helpful. it's a simple place not very fancy but it is right on the beach. They cook something for breakfast each morning, again nothing to fancy but good and included with the room, this is in addition to the contenintal breakfast they also serve. I will definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but a good base, great service...”
Reviews.Author: fuzool
Reviews.Content: The best part about the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was the customer service. The staff were extremely helpful in giving advice, directions and recommendations. The Inn also has a whole room dedicated to making it really easy for guests to explore, research and pursue any activity they might be interested in - very empowering! From tips like "go to El Yunque first thing in the morning before the tourist buses arrive, try these trails first" to "I already booked your kyaking trip for you" the staff, especially Damien, made it especially lovely to stay at the Inn. The Inn also offers not only a continental breakfast, but also offer a hot and fresh special each morning, cooked to your specifications. The downside was the price. The rooms are very basic with no TV (this is mentioned on their website, and not a big deal for most of us) but several of the rooms have great views of the beach/ocean and sunrise. The beach in front of the hotel (literally 20 feet from the hotel), though beautiful, has a strong rip-tide element, so it isn't particularly safe to swim in. One must take a long walk down the beach or drive to get to a safer beach. Overall, Luquillo is a great base for your adventures in El Yunque (Carribean Rainforest), Fajardo or even the islands of Vieques and Culebra (ferries leave from Fajardo, just 20 minutes south of Luquillo), The Luquillo Kioskos are also a draw for food-lovers and are also within a short drive or long walk from the Inn. Staying at Sunrise Luquillo Inn will afford you a lot of thoughtful advice which was worth it to me, but I likely wouldn't do it a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Late night savior!”
Reviews.Author: Kyshantry
Reviews.Content: We (me, my girlfriend, and two friends) had just gotten back in from the Fajardo-Culebra ferry, and, due to some discord in the morning, didn't much have a place to stay or a way to get there. After some yelp/trip advisor/random internet searches/talking to sketchy people, managed to turn up the sunrise beach inn, where the nice lady (Maria?) managed to find a way to combine two rooms into a package deal for us, which we very much appreciated. She also was able to help us find a taxi driver to come and take us over. Said taxi driver - who had a mohawk and had actually just been a taxi driver six years before, before he joined the air force - was particularly friendly, cheery, and chatty. He was apparently recommissioned as a taxista, seeing as how otherwise we were going to be stuck. They were also super helpful about internet, beach towels (free!), and helping us find a car rental place, even after we checked out a bit late. Super super nice people, would totally recommend it (also, it's like 3 feet from the beach. Literally)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Culebranaty
Reviews.Content: The service, the food, the sea, the night, the room, the staff everything that you need is there...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: g4finder
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for food, beach and El Yunque. Complimentary breakfast, beach chairs and towels. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are a bit small but comfortable. We had a queen bed and the balcony that looked out over the beach. With in walking distance of some great restaurants (We highly recommend Rincon de Sabor). Two pieces of advice: 1) Book a rental car early, 2) Visit El Yunque early in the day - parking can be a problem....(literally 6 - 8 minutes from this place). Great place to stay for families, couples, and elderly. Lots of locals on vacation while we were here so the beach was pretty crowded. Beach directly in front of the Inn is good for surfing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Yoily
Reviews.Content: The place is very affordable, our room had a balcony and the beach was right in front of the hotel. The breakfasts are delicious and the personnel was very friendly. We are definately going back. The room rates include beach chair and beach towels, breakfast and great service. Everyone was very friendly and we felt as if we were home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Experience The Real Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: rod8137
Reviews.Content: The Luquillo Sunrise was a perfect place to stay. The Staff was friendly and the accommodations were extremely clean. This Inn was exactly the type of place we wanted to stay at. The location was perfect, Across the street from the Surf Beach and a short walking distance to the famous Luquillo Beach. We were able to mingle with the locals and experience the real Puerto Rico. We were walking distance to great local foods and within a short drive of the Kiosks. I would definitely recommend the Luquillo Sunrise Inn to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hideaway”
Reviews.Author: wolfspiritgirl
Reviews.Content: Loved this place!!! We went there for a birthday getaway. It is a little out of the way but your across the street from the beach. Unfortunately, this section of the beach is a litlle rough and only suitable for STRONG swimmers and surfers but you do get to see some beatiful sunrises. Each room has access to its own private balcony...perfect for evening chats. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable of the surrounding area and can help you make arrangements for day/night time excursions. On this trip, we decided to take it easy by the calm side of the beach (@ 5 min drive away). Often we were the only ones on the beach. PS there's a man that rents beach chairs for $5/day...great deal. Hot breakfast was included with the room rate. Each day it's something different and the coffee was good. Often guests get together on the patio to chat about their day or their plans for the day. I would recommend this place to a friend for sure. As a matter of fact I already have. There's a restaurant around the corner from the hotel that sells delicious food for lunch/dinner. This is a great place to go and escape the hustle and bustle of daily life. It's also a good base for exploring areas like Fajardo and El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “On a great beach, and amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: Alanfxx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Puerto Rico in January and spent all of our time in Luquillo. When we brought our kids back, my wife found this hotel. The beach across the street from the hotel has great waves for body surfing, boogie boarding, or surfing. If you walk a couple of blocks from the hotel, there is a reef protected beach with very calm and shallow water. The staff at the hotel is extremely helpful. They helped to book our snorkeling and bio-bay tours and gave us advice about other places to visit in the area. They also recommended some excellent local restaurants. We'll definitely be coming back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: Al_travel_10
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an "off the beaten path" place to stay, preferably on the beach and outside the bustle of San Juan. Luquillo Sunrise worked out perfectly. The workers there were terrifically friendly and helpful, the room was in great condition and we overlooked the beach from one of the deluxe rooms. Really nice place to kill a couple days and relax. Close to the national park, not too far from San Juan, the traffic and road quality is interesting at best once you leave the capital.

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favorite Places to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kjl123
Reviews.Content: I took my nephew to Puerto Rico for the first time in his life (many trips home for me) and we had the pleasure to stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn for a couple of nights. What can I say- wonderful view, wonderful beach, wonderful breakfast, wonderful staff, wonderful stay! We enjoyed our stay so much that my nephew decided that if the navy ever sent him back (he signed up and leaves in July) that this is the place that he would like to come back to. The beach may not be the famous Luquillo beach, but the sunset and sunrise is great (though I might trim back a few trees). there ws internet access up on the balcony and I Skyped my boyfriend one morning back home as the sun was rising just to share the sunrise with him. It is convenient to El Yunque and Fajardo and many things and it is a quiet little place. We walked around the plaza and park area to get pizza one night for supper. I was so delighted with the place, that I am bringing some good friends with me to stay there when I go back in June. I have even told others about the place in hopes that they will go there. Secluded a little, but still close enough to walk to civilization without being worn out. They even helped book a snorkeling excursion (I got sick that night from a bit too much to drink and the heat of the day, but that's ok).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation with a view!”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sunrise the last week in April. All the positive comments written in previous reviews were true. The Luquillo Sunrise is a comfortable, small hotel with a warm and gracious staff. Maria was so welcoming on our arrival; we felt like we stayed there many times before. Our room was clean and comfortable with a fantastic view of the beach. Incredible sunrises every morning...and delicious breakfasts made fresh daily. Staff gave great tips on restaurants and local attractions; made the trip even more fun. Can highly recommend Pasta y Pueblo and Sandy's for dinner. And don't miss the Kiosko #13 - incredible Tapas! Luquillo is a great jump off point for El Yunque and day trips to Culebra and Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Best pick to visit East Porto Rico”
Reviews.Author: CmbSC
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this little hotel - the atmosphere is more like a bed and breakfast - for 9 nights. It is really convenient to visit the east part of Porto Rico. The ferry terminal to Culebra and Viaques is only about 15 minutes from the hotel, as well as the rain-forest. If you like luxury resort you won't find here what you are looking for, but the hotel rooms are very clean, functional, comfortable, big enough and we have hardly ever seen - we travel a lot - such an incredible staff : nice, very helpful for anything. They allow you to spend a great holiday because they take care of everything on request: booking, maps, advise, snorkel rental, beach towels and seats every day... This hotel really deserves the rating.

Reviews.Title: “Second time still just as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: Rawrachel
Reviews.Content: A year after our first trip to PR we booked to return to the Luquillo Sunrise Inn. I'm delighted to say nothing had changed - the same laid back atmosphere and rustic charm that we enjoyed in 2010 was in the air again as we sat on our balcony and enjoyed watching the sunrise and listening to the surf. Breakfast was as yummy as before - served by the same cheery staff. Sherri was in position behind the front desk and very welcoming, Damien also made us feel welcome again - remembering us from before. All in all a very relaxing and enjoyable second visit... looking forward to a third year in a row in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Stay”
Reviews.Author: LimekilnLady
Reviews.Content: This small hotel surpassed my expectations again. My husband and I stayed here for our third year in a row. We keep returning because of the outstanding staff and services provided, spotless rooms and proximity to Luquillo's blue flag beach and the El Yunque Rain Forest. From our balcony (most rooms have great views) we could see the blue/green waters, young guys surfing and, especially on weekends, families gathered. The hot breakfasts offer guests the chance to mingle and meet people from across the country and all over the world. The town itself has seen better days but I always felt safe in the area. Lots of nearby restaurants to explore as well as the ferries in Fajardo to the outer islands and tram tours of Los Cabezas de San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, and service”
Reviews.Author: Hollywoodwp3
Reviews.Content: Great base for going to the beach, exploring Culebra/Vieques, and exloring El Yunque. Beaches are wonderful and it is only a short fifteen minute drive to Fajardo to catch a ferry or excursion to the islands. The staff at the hotel is wonderful and the breakfast is great. Fifteen minutes to the rainforest. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Five-star customer service!”
Reviews.Author: PTKAdvisor
Reviews.Content: As with any travel experience, reality must meet or exceed expectations, or there's going to be some disappointment. We'd read some glowing reviews, so we were expecting a modest little inn across the road from the beach, but we weren't expecting the run-down neighborhood it sits in, nor the fact the the beach across the road is only for surfing. The gorgeous, well-worth-the-trip Luquillo Beach is a short drive (maybe half a mile?) away. If you know these things going in, you won't be disappointed with the Luquillo Beach Sunrise Inn. There is ample security, so if the neighborhood's not the greatest, we nevertheless felt very safe. The complimentary breakfast was good, if a surprise every day. Hope you get the homemade carrot bread, which is to die for! The fruit is fresh and good. If you're not too picky, you'll enjoy the food, and the terrace is very pleasant. Be prepared to share a table with other guests; that's how it works. The kiosks (kioscos) near Luquillo Beach feature all kinds of foods for later in the day. We recommend La Parrilla, which is Kiosk #2. Eating where the natives eat and where the tourists eat taught us that Puerto Rican food is blander than "tourist food." The inn loaned us all the beach towels we needed and would also have loaned us beach chairs, if we'd needed them. The service was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable, but not fancy, but the view was just right. Remember, this hotel is a good $100 a night less than the cookie-cutter resorts. It's not for the resort crowd, but for people who want a more authentic experience and great hotel staff. We were spending our nights there and our days at the beach or on excursions, so we didn't want a resort experience. We were thrilled with the Luquillo Beach Sunrise Inn and would go there again, and this time we'd plan to enjoy the Saturday morning iguana walk -- so sorry we missed that!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Courteous, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: raynan
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and well managed property. We actually stayed here 3 nights and 2 nights over a 7 night trip. We stayed in 2 different rooms. Both were clean and well prepared. The views from our room were fantastic! The Inn is located across the street from the beach. But be beware, this beach is for surfers and sun bathers. You need to walk (only) 5-8 minutes to a bathing beach or drive 5 min to the famous Luquillo Beach and Kiosks. Nightlife is OK, but then again our purpose was R&R. There is a very pleasant Bar (Beach Bar) a 5 min walk that features excellent local talent. The Inn is great jump off point for visiting the Bioluminescent Bay off Fajardo or El Yunke Natl Forest. The staff and website are VERY helpful for information. The breakfast is very adequate serving fruit, bagels, muffins, and assorted hot foods.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the beach”
Reviews.Author: jrjax1968
Reviews.Content: Awesome views, great location, and attentive staff make this a gem of Puerto Rico. 10 minutes to El Yunque and 45 minute drive to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Stay You'll Ever Have...Anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Tracyjackson1
Reviews.Content: I really don't think there are words to explain how incredible this place is! You will not be disappointed! The first time you drive in you may feel a little, well, scared....but once you drive around PR you will learn this is the norm. Once you walk in the office and meet Damien or Marisol and have a quick conversation with them you will feel at ease, ready to see your room! Now, we would recommend a 2nd or 3rd floor so you can have a balcony! We LIVED it and as many have said, you'll want to sleep with the balcony door open to fall as the waves crash quietly across the street and sing you to sleep! Oh, how I miss that! The rooms are great! They are clean, very well maintained, don't have a typical nasty hotel smell, and becomes your home away from home as soon as you step foot in the door! They serve breakfast out on the second floor patio and it's not just a typical breakfast!! They cook it for you, but also have the regular bagels, cereal, etc. We had waffles, French toast with coconut, breakfast burritos, breakfast sandwiches, etc. tropical juices and even local treats to try! They are so nice and treat you like royalty! We loved our breakfasts and looked forward to seeing what would be served the next morning. The beach is right there! It's beautiful and you can walk down the street to a little point for your own little private beach! Damian had told us about the iguanas there, too. You can go back in this little cove and see them everywhere! There's a little creek they must enjoy! You'll find whoever is at the front desk dies way more than check people in and pass out keys! They are your tour guide, GPS/map, travel agent, they even take the time to help you book tours (bio bay evening tour with Yokahu Kayak tours is amazing!), help you make reservations at the best restaurants and more! It's awesome! You'll never get this anywhere else! We loved our stay and if we get to go back, that is where we will stay! This is from the pickiest hotel stayer in the world! I can't think if anything to complain about! Thank you for the best hotel, mire like bed and breakfast, stay ever!!! Ps. Try out Pasta Y Pueble, the restaurant next door! It's amazing!

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: jessjacknickliam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great value. It is right across the street from the beach, rooms were comfortable, breakfast was good, the atmosphere is perfect, staff very helpful and friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Gateway to Northeast Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: usually_happy64
Reviews.Content: We found this place to be exactly as represented on their web site and by Trip Advisor members. It was right across from a beach and you could walk the beach all the way down to Luquillo Beach. It is a 30 minute walk by street or about 45 minutes to an hour if you walk the beach. As you walk the beach, it changes from a surfing type beach to a much calmer area for good swimming. The staff at the hotel, especially Sherry and Demian were extremely helpful in making reservations for local attractions (a snorkeling trip and an English language tour of a beautiful area outside of Fajardo with stops at the rock formations, the lighthouse and a wonderful walk through wet lands). What I liked best about this Inn was their high degree of organization. When we checked in Sherry gave us map that showed where the local restaurants were, and even pointed out one that we should stay away from (because they charged more than the menu indicated). In their lounge, adjacent to their open air dining room, they had menus for all of the restautants in the area, arranged in a logical and easily accessible manner. They also kept a notebook with comments from other guests about the restaurants. The breakfast served always included some type of hot meal (when we were there we had pancakes, French toast, breakfast pizza, and some tropical scrambled eggs). The breakfast were more than ample. Also, there were beach towels, and beach chairs that are yours for the day by just asking for them. The room was well equipped, with good air conditioning, and a wonderful balcony overlooking the ocean. I liked having a sink outside of the toilet/shower area. There was plenty of storage including a large dresser that would be locked. There was also a desk, two nightstands and a few chairs. My only complaint was with the bed. The mattress is not on a box spring and it was kind of lumpy and hard. Still, I would not hesitate going back to The Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the Coqui room”
Reviews.Author: nwindrose
Reviews.Content: The Coqui room is seperate from the rest of the Inn. There is a high rise aparment building 25' from the Coqui room and across the street is a school. From 6am to 10pm be prepared to listen to loud music, kids screaming and loud trucks. Not relaxing!! The room itself was clean and spacious but as stated above you would be better served staying in the main hotel as it is farther from the apartments and school.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: jck123123
Reviews.Content: We wanted something other than the big resort thing. Located on the beach and close to the rain forest. This fit the bill perfectly. Our room was not ocean side, but rather in a seperate building in the back. We had basically a small suite. Lovely! King side bed, seperate sitting area, fridge. All very clean and cute. Breakfast was super on a terrace overlooking the ocean. Private parking included. Good recommendations. The staff was really good. Would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Service With Beautiful Views - A Great Puerto Rico Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cenbaneses
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a night at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn with our three childrend (8, 6 and 16 months). We Flew in to San Juan and selected Luquillo because of its close proximity to El Yunque (the rainforest), which was our destination the next day. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful the entire time. We stayed in the "green room", which is an experiment with low environmental impact living, including solar lighting and AC and rainwater toilets and showers. This is a very nice suite that is actually a separate house located behind the hotel. It was clean, bright, comfortable and quiet, and a cool experience for us and our kids. There is a nice yard between the green room and the hotel with pretty palms and our boys enjoyed the opportunity to run and play there (and made a few friends over the wall separating the hotel from the neighboring apartment). Breakfast is great and served by very nice staff on the second floor terrace, which is a stunning setting. We very much enjoyed our brief stay there and would definitely stay there again. We stayed at the Fajardo Inn once before, and it was okay, but I would chose Luquillo Sunrise. Oh - one other thing - dinner! I was disappointed we could not get in to Pasta y Pueblo, the little restaurant right around the corner that gets rave reviews here on tripadvisor (we got there at 6 and they couldn't fit us in - business is good!). We walked through town to Rincon, a local, very Puerto Rico restaurant. Food was good, the establishment's owner was very nice. For those not used to Puerto Rico, they may find the walk a little unsettling. Just remember that poor doesn't mean dangerous - Luquillo has its share of poverty but is perfectly safe. - Chris

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly place safe area great beaches for walking and swimming.”
Reviews.Author: stme1234
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay, I wanted to stay at resort and my partner wanted to try Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. She was right.....We saved a ton of money and had a great time. Room 34 is the best in the place (top floor big balocony) so keep that in mind if you stay here. The shower/toilet area a little tight and the TV stand gets in the way a little when walking by it. Besides that it's clean and comfortable. Oh the breakfast....to die for and it's included! The only other nice touch that would have been nice is coffee,tea etc avaialble 24/7, but there is a nice coffee place in the square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kliberator
Reviews.Content: Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was a truely great hotel. This is a small hotel with about 17 rooms right on the beach. There is nothing overly fancy about this hotel so if you are looking for resort-style lodging this is not the place for you. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with a nice balcony. The ocean is 2 steps from the front gate and small beach is a 2-block walk. The best part about this hotel is the staff. They are incredibly friendly and are happy to provide suggestions on tours, restaurants and anything else you could imagine (they even provide hand-drawn maps with landmarks!). If you are looking to relax and go off the beaten path a little, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean views hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: OHIOFrequentFlyers
Reviews.Content: Luquillo has beautiful beaches and this little hotel is right on the water. All the basics were just fine, and we also enjoyed the balcony, the use of beach chairs and boogie board, first floor shower to wash off the sand, and the lovely breakfast area with both continental breakfast items and one hot breakfast special item served by friendly staff members. A computer with internet is available, a nice learning and play table for kids, comfortable chairs to just sit back and watch the surf. Great small restaurant next door for dinner. Reasonably priced. Free, secure parking.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be #1 in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: LEJ45
Reviews.Content: This place should be #1 in Puerto Rico for being a GREAT deal, having great food, and a GREAT location. My husband and I stayed here during part of our honeymoon in June 2010. At first we were given a room next to the caretaker, who honestly creeped us out a bit, so we asked to be moved and were accommodated. We end up on the third floor with an incredible view. All rooms have a balcony with spectacular views of the ocean. The place is about ten steps to the quiet, stunning beach. Truth be told the neighborhood could be described as rundown, but it never appeared dangerous, at least not during the day. Back to the hotel: the hotel not only provides beach towels, but makes a HOT breakfast each morning (based on a set menu) and still has a well done continental breakfast as well (pastries, cereal, coffee, etc). The view from the open eating area is phenomenal and sets the stage for a lovely Puerto Rican morning. You must stay here if you have a rental car and can/should get out of the crazy San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the most relaxing place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: waterspirit_7
Reviews.Content: The owners and management of Luquillo Sunrise thought of everything when putting this place together, from the beach-front location, secure off-street parking and yummy complimentary breakfasts to the restaurant reviews and snorkeling tour reservations. We didn't want for anything while we were there!! The staff were all very helpful and knowledgeable about when/how/where to go and provided detailed maps and directions (roads are a bit confusing). Our room was a bit cramped, but had nice amenities like a small fridge and microwave and large balcony to enjoy the beach view. We didn't feel the need to use the available A/C and slept with the balcony door open to let the crashing waves lull us to sleep. The bed was mostly comfortable, except for the plastic mattress cover and plastic pillow covers (protection from bedbugs??) Though we could view the surfers from our balcony, we also enjoyed grabbing the free-use beach chairs and walking across the street to relax with some wine and cheese while the surfers finished their rides as the sun set behind us. We walked the 5 minutes down the street to an incredible swimmer's beach with a handful of other people enjoying the sun, sand and surf. Later, we took a bit of a longer walk (about 30 minutes) to the Luquillo Public Beach, which has restroom facilities, lifeguards, showers and food stands. Another day we drove the 5 minutes to this beach and paid the $4.55 parking fee, unloaded the free-use beach chairs from the trunk and relaxed for the day. The Miramar Cafe on the Plaza (~8 minute walk) had delicious and reasonably priced dinners, very friendly staff and a comfortable atmosphere. Twice we stopped at Chachi's ice cream shop on the plaza to enjoy mouth-watering local-made sorbet in flavors like passionfruit, coconut and corn (yes corn...tastes just like sweet corn!!!) Overall, the location of this place was perfect for experiencing so many of PR's fun activities: 15 minutes to El Yunque, 30 minutes to Fajardo and the ferry to Culebra (Flamenco Beach), 40 mins. to San Juan and the airport. I highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Little slice of pardise close to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: erniebrauchli
Reviews.Content: When looking to get away from the city and be close to the beach at a wonderful inn with a view Liquillo Sunrise Beach inn fits the bill. Everyone was so helpful, rooms with ocean views. Breakfast on the open air balcony is included and a place to meet other guest and learn about the places to eat or see in the area. Staff is so helpful. We extended our stay to make this home base for a relaxing vacation on the beach . The inn even recommended a local Surfing instructor that got me up on a board during the first lesson. Our Room was clean and simply decorated, with good bed, strong AC and ocean view with shower. Not large but they have different type rooms for your taste. Ernie from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - not so great beds”
Reviews.Author: siistibuddy
Reviews.Content: We found this place charming and the staff fantastic! The location is absolutely the best! The mattresses were a step above plywood however and are in need of replacing. The breakfast was nice, there are nice small restaurants nearby, and the beach is great! The staff cannot be complimented enough! They are friendly, accommodating and they all speak great English! Don't forget to take a day to hike the rainforest, its very very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: hhsfi2
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous views, good food, friendly and helpful staff, great value! We arrived late in the evening and got lost. The person "on call" was so gracious in helping us find out way. He stayed on the phone talking us through the directions as we drove. He even walked about a block to wave us down. Our room, although a bit small, had a beautiful view. There was a festival with fantastic live music in town that night (a great surprise). The music could be heard from the hotel which was fine until we tried to go to sleep. I was concerned that I could not sleep due to the noise. Luckily, the music stopped soon after. The staff was extremely helpful. They made great suggestions about where to go and even made phone calls to help us get reservations. Breakfast was delicious including fresh fruit, juice, cereal (hot and cold), an entree, and plenty of coffee or tea. Luquillo is a great location just a few miles from the El Yunque rain forest and the bio-bay. The surf in front of the hotel is fabulous to see, a bit wild and not for swimming. There is a swimming beach a a few minutes walk away. We took the 10 a.m. walk with a staff member to see the iguanas. Seeing the iguanas was interesting although the river had a lot of trash in it. which was disappointing. If you go on this walk, do not wear shoes/sneakers because your feet will get wet. Luquillo is truly a gem. Unfortunately the locals do not seem to recognize the amazing location and there is quite a bit of trash even on the beach. Be sure to eat at Pasta y Pueblo just a block down from the inn. The food is incredible and the owner and staff are fantastic. An unbelievable value! You would pay much more for this quality of food in most places. We loved the great food, beautiful views, nearness to activities and the friendly people. Next visit, we will get a room on the third floor which is more quiet and has better views. We were disappointed by the trash.

Reviews.Title: “nice beachfront spot”
Reviews.Author: georgiapeaches34
Reviews.Content: despite PR's notorious lack of road signs, the inn was pretty easy to find. the staff are extremely helpful and welcoming, and everyone is bilingual. the room was a bit spartan for the price (had a plastic beach chair for one furniture item) but was very clean and spacious. great tv and cable setup for end-of-the-day zoning out. the inn is extremely well-situated in the town, right next to the beach, close to a bunch of great restaurants. it is gated as well, although crime was never an issue- everyone is very friendly and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...truly”
Reviews.Author: cmekde
Reviews.Content: The staff was not only welcoming, but accommodating on every aspect...we even had breakfast with the owners one morning! Our room was A2, which is the small house/condo at the front of the hotel. All three rooms were extremely comfortable, clean, and well appointed. The best feature by far was the enormous terra cotta balcony facing Luquillo Beach- one of the most pictured in all of Puerto Rico. We sat and drank and just let the ocean breeze roll in, sometimes staff would even come sit and talk and see if we needed anything, or just give us info on what to do and where to go. Parking is gated, so cars are safe, and the area itself beautiful and fairly safe. You have to consider the area and you're usual surroundings....this is not mayberry. But it is NOT dangerous, we walked the entire perimeter and all through Luquillo, no problems, just friendly people. If you can't handle the poorer outskirts, then...well, then you probably shouldn't be traveling outside of a tour bus anyways. But the strip on the beach, which is where the resort is, is absolutely gorgeous, and any stay here will be memorable, beautiful, and amazingly fun. I have traveled all over the world and found few places so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Rest,Relax, Release”
Reviews.Author: GoyaBean1
Reviews.Content: This quiet gem is off the beaten path...Wake up and go to sleep to the gentle sounds of the waves crashing just across the street! Delicious breakfast served every morning includes locally grown coffee! Rooms clean and comfortable and airconditioned.15 Min ride from the airport. The staff is knowledgable and helpful. Ther is so much to do within short distance..Hacienda Caraballi (go-carts,horseback riding and more), El Yunque, oh and you have to stop at the kiosks in Luquillo especially the one on the end Roca Taino for lunch. Local surf shop 2 blocks away will give you paddleboard lessons right across the street from the inn. Restaurants within walking distance. You will definitely leave (not really want to leave) rested and relaxed!!! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Made My Vacation Perfect”
Reviews.Author: OBeeJay
Reviews.Content: A touch of class! In a very desirable location on the ocean. The B&B offers morning breakfast - hot food and Continental buffet. Both were good and fresh. The room has a balcony great view of the sun rise, Ocean. Room is clean, sufficient space, comfortable bed and pillows. Clean sheets and towels. Everything you would expect to have in a hotel they have it in this location. Although this is a relatively young operation, the owners are long time hotel operators and understand what is important to their guests. in the area there is an ample selection of activities and there are books / details the B&B has organized to help assist you become acquainted with relaxing and having fun.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable bad experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelers_dog
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Puerto Rico, and we wanted to stay in a good location near the rain forest with lots of local people (not the usual tourist site). This so called hotel was listed as one of the best spots on the island; to our surprise it was only a bad bed and breakfast. The room decor was taken from what was left from a 1980 resort, the shower had mildew on the walls and we had an ancient TV set with cables hanging everywhere. The location of the place was the only thing the saved our trip, since we didn't spent to much money on transportation; we spend most of the time walking at El Yunque. We are an adventurous couple but will never dare to stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: sacking
Reviews.Content: What a great place. RIGHT ON THE BEACH. Free wi-fi. Free breakfast. Ocean front view. Slept listening to the waves crashing on the beach, which is about 50 feet away. Easy access to Hwy 3 and the rain forest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: kimmers722
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, the surrounding area near the hotel was a bit of a turn off. You'll find layers of graffiti, crumbling homes, stray animals and wandering people. I was more than hesitant and wondered if we made a poor decision to stay at Luquillo Beach. When we arrived at the hotel, we expressed our concerns to Damien, the front desk clerk. He explained there was poverty everywhere in Luquillo and assured us that the area was safe. He did manage to put our mind at rest and he showed us to our room. On the way, we spotted a huge iguana, enjoying the noon day sun. The room was fine - it was clean and well maintained. The king sized bed was roomy, although the sheets were scratchy and the mattress uncomfortable. The balcony overlooked the water and the view was spectacular. The complimentary breakfast was great and they also sold water & beer downstairs (although you could walk to the corner store a block away for cheaper beer). Damien also gave us some handouts of the Rainforest and the local places to go for food. We stayed two nights - on the Friday night, I was awoken at midnight by children literally screaming at the tops of their lungs, while hanging out on the beach. The night before had been peaceful and quiet -- so maybe it was because it was *officially* the weekend? All in all, the hotel itself was fine... although I didn't sleep as well as I would have preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with great views and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: randyehrsam
Reviews.Content: We had a great time enjoying the wonderful beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful in making our stay an enjoyable experience. We really enjoyed those variety of breakfasts each day. Also enjoyed the selection of restaurants within walking distance from our hotel. Manager Capt. Sheri was very good at recommending places to visit and we enjoyed her joining us on our excursion to Monkey Island. We would recommend staying at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn and we look forward to our next trip to Luquillo. Thanks for all your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A very homey, low-key, relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: karenm521
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel and loved it. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating. The breakfasts (included in the cost) were outstanding. The place is right on the beach and we went to bed each night to the sound of waves crashing. It is a 10 minute drive to the rainforest. Great for families or anyone who wants an affordable, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best bet in Luquillo”
Reviews.Author: travelerparker
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that we hated Puerto Rico and would never recommend it for a vacation spot. That said, if you end up there, and want to go to a decent beach not too far from San Juan, then Luquillo is a good bet. And if you are in Luquillo, the Sunrise is a great place to stay. It's nothing fancy, but the folks who run it are great. Really solid customer service. Great breakfasts. The rooms are small and dated, but have nice balconies with ocean views (over the parking lot and a street). The bed was a little soft, but pretty comfortable. The A/C made a weird noise, but worked well. Overall it was okay, and again, probably your best bet for that area if you don't want to stay at a resort. The location can't be beat, either. It's across from the surf beach and a 5 minute walk to great swimming beaches. I do want to note that the area around the hotel looks really sketchy. We went to buy a bottle of wine at the local corner store, and it reminded me a bit of the inner city of LA. Pawn shops, guys hanging out drinking beer in front of the store, they sold cigarettes by the singles...that kind of place. And the local pub does security checks before you are allowed in. That being said, everyone was super friendly and we did not feel at all threatened or like it was dangerous--but I wish someone had explained the neighborhood a bit so I thought I would describe it. If I was a woman alone, I would not walk around that area at night. Also, you need a car to do anything. This part of PR is very much like LA, where everything is in strip malls and you need a car. One final point--if you do go here, I recommend not taking RTE 3 or RTE 66--both are ugly, strip-mall laden patches of asphalt that have a ton of traffic and stoplights. An alternative route is 187 or 189 (I can't recall exactly) that takes you along the beach and through groves. It's quite lovely and we actually got to San Juan quicker using it. Others said it would take 10 minutes longer--either way, it's worth the detour. Just look on any map and it's the beach route. Generally well marked.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service”
Reviews.Author: travelswrites
Reviews.Content: The Luquillo Sunrise surpassed our expectations, especially when compared to the other places we stayed at around Puerto Rico that were similarly priced. The motel-style hotel was clean, the public computer was brand new and updated, the breakfast included pancakes, bacon, breads and fruits plus drinks. The amazingly friendly and informative front desk help gave us a three-page written summary of where everything was in town, and the conference room had menus and commentary from years of previous guests that helped us choose restaurants and travel excursion companies. Unbelievably, they also lend guests beach chairs and beach towels so you don't have to bring your own!! There was secure parking for the car, which could be key in the area. They let you print boarding passes for free, too. This is not a sterile Sheraton but it was quite clean and nice, with a balcony facing the ocean in our third-floor room. We chatted with other guests at a long shared table during breakfast. The B7B is located on a surf beach in Luquillo, one of the most beautiful beaches on the north side of PR. There's a surf shop a block away. Walking down the successive beaches you encounter a surf beach out front, then a reef (good to snorkel, they explained, but you must be a strong swimmer), then a semi-calm bay beach, then a very calm public beach with full facilities. On the day we were there it was clean and full of families. You are near enough to Fajardo that you can drive for 30 minutes to the area where all the kayak tours leave in the evening to tour the bioluminescent bay, which I would definitely recommend as an outing. The entry to El Yunque forest is quite close, also. You could easily be based in Luquillo and do El Yunque. Within Luquillo is a famous strip of beachside kiosk restaurants that open both to a street and to the beach. We ate at a burger kiosk because our son was getting tired of mofungos and other local foods. The menus are semi-gourmet and highly varied among the kiosks. You could walk there from the B&B but you might want to drive. I understand that the whole area is very busy on weekends although it was quite quiet a lunchtime on a weekday. My one complaint would be that the AC blew on my head while we slept. I suppose I could have turned it down. There's also a ceiling fan. Highly recommended if you like small, well-located, friendly places.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: traveler2202
Reviews.Content: Marsha (sp?), Gary, and Demian (sp?) were absolutely wonderful hosts - the accommodations of the Green Room were great. Relaxing, private, peaceful, comfortable, and clean. All staff were helpful and welcoming, the breakfast hostesses (especially Seli) were incredibly informative when we inquired about area restaurants, transport to scenic areas, rainforest, and beaches. Other guests were friendly but respected our space. Pricing was reasonable and worth every penny. Requests for any extra towels, etc. was immediately attended to. I would recommend the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn without question to anyone visiting the area and when we return we will be requesting the Green Room again.

Reviews.Title: “talk about layed back”
Reviews.Author: rupemack
Reviews.Content: First thing we were told was that a Leatherback turtle had laid it's eggs on the beach across from the Inn the night before. The beach that I saw outside my second story window was a surfing beach-La Pared. Winds were heavy at times but this made for a comfortable experience as it was getting warm. The owners, Marsha and Gary, are very layed back and meet you for your breakfast--continental and hot--(included ) upstairs on the half covered patio. They have information on restaurants-- including sample menus, bio tours,and even have Iguana siting tours--Gary walks interested folks down the beach to a grove of tree ferns, tropical trees and an inland river, where you can take pics of Iguanas from 1 ft to 4-5 ft in length hiding amongst the folliage..They even have notebooks that visitors have written their reviews of the local attractions in which we found very helpful. This is a comfortable, well maintained, well constructed --so that not a window shook as the winds pummeled the inn--modern facility with Hispanic flare. You are just about 10 minutes to the entrance of El Junque. These folks know this territory and are very interested in making your experience once in a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Great escape with the important comforts”
Reviews.Author: KP2010Mpls
Reviews.Content: We had about a week to relax near a beach and couldn't think of a better way than what we got. Away from the urban clamour but close enough to purchase usual supplies(Walgreens etc) and just over from the beach.
