The balcony view made the value great, and then came the cleanliness, breakfast and excellent basic amenities that often go unthought of, such as the ice bucket and ice supply. Excellent information, from local attractions, food services, traffic guide, local environment and policy, was provided in both references in the common area and by word of mouth from the wonderfully welcoming and knowledgable hosts. It was too easy to sink into comfortable privacy and then to emerge into a laid back scene with other guests and the town. And if La Pared is firing at 6-8, the view down the line doesn't need to get any better than from the balcony (Keep an eye out for the neat little peeling left reef to the balcony view's left).

Reviews.Title: “If you prefer small hotels, this is the top place to stay in PR.”
Reviews.Author: LimekilnLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned after a great visit last year to stay again for 3 days this May. We found the same helpful staff to provide useful information about places to go and suggestions galore on where to eat. The third floor balcony room offered a wonderful view of the Atlantic and its pounding surf where the young guys tried out their boards. Our room was spotless, large and furnished in modest style. Our queen bed was comfortable. I appreciated having the lock box to secure valuables (mostly computer stuff). It took us about 45 mins. to drive from the airport and though it's tricky to find the place the first time, follow their directions and you'll be fine. We went to El Yunque Rain Forest, San Juan, and the Isle of Viequez during our stay.The inn is near the famous kiosks of Loquillo. While we didn't eat there last year because they looked, well, dukmpy, we asked for staff's recommendations and ate at #9 and went back a second time. We tried the Luqillo Beach Park for an afternoon. It's a blue flag beach (one of the better ones on the island) near the kiosks. Water was wonderful. We also took advantage of a laudromat nearby that Demian knew. (Again, tricky to find tucked in a plaza but his directions were correct.) The inn's location made these visits easy. We were fortunate to meet the owners, Marsha and Gary, who joined guests for a hot breakfast ( yum) during their visit. Hardworking people dedicated to keeping the hotel in great shape. We stayed in PR 10 days this visit and hope to return next year and make this hotel our home base.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more - great place, nice folks”
Reviews.Author: slc624
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn, coming in to SJU, first night out to Vieques for the Biobay, then an easy day and off around the island. We didn't require much more than a safe and relatively comfortable place to sleep, with parking. We found a lot more, though: very nice people, very comfortable accommodations, an excellent hot breakfast included in the price of the room, and discounts to activities in the area - including the tour we had already booked to the Biobay, saving us $10 apiece. Beach towels are provided free, and the office even has cold Medallas for $2 each, which was most welcome when we got back from our trip to Vieques at midnight but still wanted to sit on the balcony, which is within 75 feet of the beach, for a while. There's no refrigerator or microwave in the room, but we iced down the bottle of juice we bought in the ice bucket. And there's juice for breakfast anyway. We were on the third floor, and had a wonderful sunrise view. It was very nice in the evening as well. As two middle-aged women, we were a little put off by three flights of stairs with no elevator, but Ed the handyman helped us with the big suitcase, and the view was worth it. He and everyone there was very helpful and informative, and they have notebooks full of information about restaurants and activities in the area in the breakfast room - which is itself delightful, basically a covered cabana on the second floor terrace. There is a long table for those feeling companionable, and a couple of smaller ones for those less sociable at breakfast. The parking is right in front, very near the stairways, and behind a gate, with remote provided. There aren't quite as many spaces as rooms, but the area seems pretty safe to leave a car on the street if the lot is full. Overall, we had a great time here and definitely recommend it to those who don't need a lot of extras, just a comfortable room with a great view and a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: lesmayr
Reviews.Content: If you want a big resort with lots of restaurants, pools, casinos, etc. then DON"T stay here! But if you like a quiet comfortable resort with a beautiful view of the ocean this is the place for you. It is very pretty, with clean rooms, a helpful staff, delicious breakfast right on the beautiful coastline. You can walk right out on the beach and they will even give you chairs and towels to use. For those reviewers who complained about the neighborhood you must remember that in Puerto Rico most people have little money. The area was perfectly safe with friendly people nearby. The parking lot is gated so you don't have to worry about your car. We loved being out of the big city but still close to many wonderful attractions like El Yunque. The beaches are much nicer here and in the Fajardo area than in San Juan. Our only regret is we didn't have more time.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: shapoopie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice budget option for Luquillo. The rooms are clean, the big terrace has sun chairs and hammocks which are really nice. The place was completely empty when we visited during the week, and it was nice to have everything to ourselves. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, gave us great recommendations on where to eat, and direction to find where the leatherback turtles are nesting. The only thing that threw me was they have plastic covers or something on the mattresses. This makes the bed uncomfortable and noisy. Breakfast is included with the room, but plan to eat somewhere else. The first day they served us some gross "breakfast pizza", and the second day was another kinda gross breakfast sandwich. They also have a "continental" breakfast with some pineapple/melon slices, breads, juice, coffee, instant oatmeal and cakes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place with great view and convenient to many things.”
Reviews.Author: srnflamingo
Reviews.Content: We did not have a rental car, but small markets, restaurants, medical center were all within walking distance. We walked all the way down the beach to the food kiosks one day. Great beaches all along the way. The view from your balcony at Luquillo looks right out to the beach which is directly across the street. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: crayz2sew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Sunrise Beach Inn in Luquillo and thought it was great. The hosts were extremely helpful with lots of suggestions. They offered to make reservations for us and even contacted a local resident who made jewelry because we were interested. The location was great--right on the beach. The breakfasts were different each morning, with lots of fresh fruit and pastries. Everything was clean and the only problem we had was slipping on the tile floor when we were wet from the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gem”
Reviews.Author: gmae1
Reviews.Content: We chose Luquillo Sunrise Inn based on TripAdivsor comments and are very glad we did. The city of Luquillo, itself, is a bit desolate & many of the building are in need of some serious repair. But, this Inn is a diamond in the ruff! There are about 12 rooms I believe, and each one has a totally clear view of the beach, as each room has a balcony off of it. The rooms were superb, we thought. Very clean, tiled floors, and beach themed. Cable TV with dressers are included. The bathroom is a tight squeeze, but since you won't spend much time there we think that is not an issue. There is a nice new computer available for guests with internet access located in a breezeway that also has brochures, and advice on eating out and going on excursions.Breakfast is served daily on the patio which overlooks the swaying palms and the ocean. There are no buildings or any structures obstructing your view from any room at the Inn or from the patio section. Ah, the breakfast is delightful--pastries, bagels, lemon bread, homemade egg breakfast sandwiches, a variety of fruit, fresh juice, coffee, and hot cocoa. The service is very impressive! They lend beach towels, boogie boards, and the like. They offer advice on where to go to eat, where to shop, and will reserve excursions for you, too. They are quite The grounds are impeccable. Hammock out back and beautiful landscaping. And they also have gated parking for your rental car if you have one. The beach areas are not crowded at all, and palms line the beaches. If you don't mind big waves you can swim right out in front of the Inn, if you prefer little waves, you'll want to walk down the beach a little ways, about 5 minutes. Beautiful scenery at the beach. Very family oriented, too. Some other things to know: The restaurant Pasta y Pueblo just lost their license, for whatever reason, I think because they let their license lapse. So, this is not an option anymore for eating out. However, we found a new restaurant that has high quality food, and a pretty atmosphere on the square, it was called El Fugon, or something like that. It is right near a bakery and across the street from a church. We also ate at King Seafood, which has a fun atmosphere after 8pm with Salsa music. It is a small place, but good food for the price. El Yunque is just about 5 miles down the road from Luquillo Sunrise Inn. Go early in the day to avoid crowds.

Reviews.Title: “The unvarnished report”
Reviews.Author: bragi
Reviews.Content: Things I wish I had known before staying here: -the neighborhood is not good; it's pocked with abandoned, destroyed, and partially finished buildings -- and generously decorated with litter of all kinds (think plastic bottles and used pads) -I never exactly felt safe when walking around, and at one point a local restaurant owner told us to be "careful" on the beach and walking around; additionally, there are plenty of feral dogs and cats running around -the beach across the street from the hotel is for surfing; you won't be swimming there -you may have to deal with the occasional ultra-loud stereo trucks driving around the neighborhood -wifi is spotty and is only available in two rooms and the breakfast area (where you wouldn't want to bring your laptop anyway, since it'd get blasted with salty air. Note though, that there is a public computer you can use, which works well.) All in all, this place charges way more than they should. We paid $150-ish per night, and it should have been $75-90. If you're going to Puerto Rico to hang out at the beach, and want to relax and get away from it all, stay at the Caribe Hilton. While you may see parts of the "real Puerto Rico" here, I'm wagering that's not why you're traveling -- and not exactly in line with how this place advertises itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach an Hour from San Juan”
Reviews.Author: UK Bluecrow
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay on the beach about an hour East from San Juan is the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. The rooms are very nice sized and well furnished with a mini-fridge, microwave, ceiling fan, TV, and good A/C. The complimentary continental breakfast was satisfying with a selection of fruits and pastries plus they serve a hot entrÃ©e every day. The beach is right across the street and you can walk east along the shore without running out of sand. Iâ€™m not sure how far the beach goes since we turned around after an hour. We did see a turtle nest that had been made the night before. The beach along this area has a lot of surf and there are a lot of surfers. There are eating places close by but we were there on Good Friday and almost all of them were closed as was most of PR that day.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ona16117
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights and loved it! The room was clean and comfortable, the view was fabulous, and the breakfasts were top notch. If you are going to Puerto Rico and want to stay in the north east section, this inn is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, Outstanding Friendly Service !!”
Reviews.Author: CoraE112
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out, the service and friendliness of the staff and the " hands on " owners NEVER faultered....it was consistantly outstanding, knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and always smiling!!!!!!!!!!!!! The location is awesome, we had a bacony room facing the ocean and were lulled to sleep by the sound of crashing waves, and saw gorgeous sunrises in the morning. Take the iguna walk with the owner...lots of fun!!! I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel across the street from the ocean”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasrich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We enjoyed our stay. We walked the coast going in a westerly direction (45 min.) to a huge, well maintained park / beach. We swam in this area and visited the very diverse food stalls, just west of the park. The complimentary vegetarian breakfasts we had were O.K. The medium size town of Luquillo can be kind of crowed and chaotic on weekends but it was quiet on weekdays. The staff at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn were all great!

Reviews.Title: “The glory of a condo on the beach without the high rise condo-& blessed with the best food found at a bed and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: PamFan
Reviews.Content: 3 major tips: Directions--The say to turn AFTER the kiosks, these are NOT anything like the ones you check into at the airport! Puerto Rican KIOSKS are a line of tiny shacks that run together like a "strip mall" in the U.S. They look old and run down, some sell items and some are eating places. Sunrise--We were told to look at the sheet on the bulletin board in the room where the free breakfast is held to find out exactly what time the sunrise would be the next morning. The sheet said 6:45 a.m. So we set the clock for 6:30 a.m. I woke up at 6:15 because of the sunshine coming in the windows! I ran to the balcony and saw people across the street already surfing! I was so disappointed as we stayed there to specifically see the sunrise up over the ocean! At exactly 6:45 a tiny bright ball of orange came up in the distance over the horizon about the a small peninsula. What I learned is this: in that part of the world, the sunrise is not the same as in Iowa! With the tilt of the earth, most of the suns rays bounced up to the area WAY BEFORE the time you could actually see the sun come over the horizon. At least that's what happened in Feb. 2010. My son said I was apparently thinking of what we call "dawn"--when the black sky begins to first get the sun's beautiful rays coming in. He saw sunlight coming up at 5:40! So if you go for the old fashioned sunrise, plan to get up at least an hour earlier than what the schedule sheet says! Tsunami Safety--Recommendations say to go the 3rd floor, which is their top floor.

Reviews.Title: “perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Rawrachel
Reviews.Content: We arrived from UK (!) not that many people can say that they're from London in Luquillo. We'd chosen this hotel online in advance because of its location. We weren't disappointed - and the weather was perfect. The town is worth exploring (we were on foot having opted to not hire a car) and there are plenty of bars and restaurants catering for tourists and residents that are equally welcoming, within walking distance. The choice of beaches nearby is good although we favoured La Pared that enjoys the Atlantic surf but isn't so rough you can't pop in for a dip! The hotel is in the perfect place to relax and with is unrivalled in the service and quality it offers. With a seaview room expect to fall asleep to the sound of the waves. Nothing is too much trouble for the attentive staff (Damian was a font of of all knowledge) and with the breakfasts included its great value. Get out, explore, enjoy... Luquillo maybe not be a secret for much longer!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: whit7
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, location and breakfast. Good restaurants nearby; great beach.

Reviews.Title: “We were surprisingly pleased.”
Reviews.Author: NoJa
Reviews.Content: We had read all the reviews and weren't sure if this would be a good place to stay. But it surely was. The office folks were very helpful, and the breakfasts excellent. We had a balcony that overlooked the ocean. It was well worth the extra cost, and we sat out on the deck in the evening. It is true that the surrounding area, at first glance, seems a bit sketchy. There are many empty houses nearby where the properties haven't been maintained. However, we felt very safe walking around, even at night. There are benches on the beach, just across the street, which was a wonderful place to sit and watch the ocean. A better swimming beach is just up the road. Very few people were there, and we had our pick of palm trees to sit under. We, too, recommend the Pasta y Pueblo restaurant just around the corner. We bought a bottle of wine at the corner liquor store, left it with them early, and they chilled it for our return.

Reviews.Title: “From one B&B to another.”
Reviews.Author: des4fac
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a great place to stay. We thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality, hot breakfasts, comfortable and clean rooms, free internet access and most important, the friendly owners and staff. Be sure to check out the small cafe "Pasta Y Pueblo" right next door. We know what it takes to serve the public and applaud your exceptional ability to set the standard. We highly recommend Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn to all. Des & Judy - whiteoakslodge.com

Reviews.Title: “Great place to feel Puerto Rican”
Reviews.Author: smikexxx
Reviews.Content: Lots of places in walking distance. Food, both at the on-site breakfasts and surrounding restaurants, was very good. Stopped at Guava's for the Super Bowl. Freddy made us feel very comfortable and fed us his sampler that was fantastic! Great surfing beach. Very busy on the weekends. If you're willing to walk, there are beaches better for swimming down the ...beach. Say hi to Charlie the dog at the Surf Shop. The Coqui room was nicely decorated, had a private patio, and served us well. If there would be a 'beef' it would be that this specific room is close to the neighbors, a multiple unit apartment, and it can get noisy. The staff was well aware of the situation and were taking appropriate action to solve it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stafff, get a good breakfast .....”
Reviews.Author: tompa49
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay here. If you are looking for a quiet place to walk a cross the street and watch the breakers, surfers and maybe dip your foot in the ocean, just sit on your balcony or the secound story patio and relax its the place it's the ticket. A great place to use as a base to go from. We did a day in Old San Juan, a day in the rain forest, one day walking Luquillo, hitting the kioskos after a morning on the beach. One evening we took the kayak up to the Bio luminescent bay with help from the staff. Everyone could not do enough to make you feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place- would def go back”
Reviews.Author: bebops87018
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in a Queen room and were very satisfied. Beautiful view of the beach, nice location, balcony, good hot breakfast and fruit each morning, comfortable room, and great staff. Locked, secure parking in their lot (they give you an opener in case you leave and come back after it's closed for the evening). They have a room with a computer to use and well as free wifi and piles of menus for area restaurants and information on things to do. Also guest books where people write about where they ate, what they did, and suggestions, Close to El Yunque and Fajardo- worth the drive to get out of San Juan. The beach near the kioskos is $3 parking or a 45 minute walk from the hotel- very, very nice for playing in the water and had lifeguards, souvenir shops, and a variety of places to eat- shaded areas to sit as well. The beach across from the hotel is pretty for walking but rough for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Gem on the Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: jiminvirginiaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay one evening and would have definitly stayed several more if our schedule permitted. It is just as advertised! All rooms have balcony facing the ocean and a great breakfast! Rooms were small but very clean and modern. The staff was very friendly and the location cant be beat. The fact that you can leave your doors open to hear the ocean waves all night was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYadventuregirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, after discovering it on TripAdvisor. Reviews were all on the money. Incredibly friendly staff, great on-the-beach location, easy access to El Yunque, beach, Fajardo, San Juan. Rooms are basic, but clean & air conditioned, with tiled floors & balcony overlooking beach. Great to hear waves at night. Breakfast on terrace was delish, with wonderful, super sweet cook / server. Guy at the front desk could not have been any more helpful. Free parking, beach towels & beach chairs. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Luquillo Sunrise Inn was one of the most enjoyable experiences we have had.”
Reviews.Author: crackerpacker
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a high-end, up-scale, posh resort facility where you tip the white-gloved valet $5 to wheel your suitcase to your room, you will not want to stay here. But you will want to stay at Luquillo Sunrise Inn if you enjoy any or all of the following: spectacular ocean view just a few steps from your room, hospitality staff that treats you like their best friend, relaxed and peaceful atmosphere with clean, comfortable and secure accommodations, home-made breakfast with a variety of baked items and fresh, local fruit. To the Neff's - you and your staff have a hidden gem at Luquillo Sunrise Inn. It is one of a kind and one that we will find every time we are in Puerto Rico. To Damien - thanks for the recommendation on one of the best snorkeling sites we have seen and for the referral to Pasta Y Pueblo - a textbook example of why you should not "judge a book by its cover".

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden value!”
Reviews.Author: ladyjane2
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night so we decided to find something inexpensive. We are a middle to upper class family that usually books large rooms for $300-500/night. I found this little hotel on the internet on a beach I wanted to be on, and when I inquired about the rooms, the owner was very helpful and thorough. She went out of her way to email me several times for the perfect fit. We arrived to find out it was really nice. We really enjoy fitting into cultural areas without tourists everywhere and this was definately the perfect fit. We arrived 4 hours earlier than check in and the owner was absolutely okay with it and fit us right into a room. The area was nice, beautiful beach, the people were very friendly ~ a nice little town.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlowder500
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed this hotel! It was very nice, clean, and ideally located. The staff were all very warm and friendly, and certainly made us feel very welcome. We really enjoyed being able to open the doors and listen to the ocean, and enjoy the sea breezes. I would recommend it highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kathc727
Reviews.Content: Small guesthouse (18 rooms), perfect if you're not looking for a big resort experience. Rooms have decent-sized balconies facing the ocean - sound of waves to go to sleep! Close to activities and attractions - rain forest, snorkling trips to Vieques and Culebra, kayaking in bioluminescent bay.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had more time to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bostonmike72
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay here somewhat last minute. (We had an extra day and a half in Puerto Rico and wanted to visit El Yunque.) I chose based on the positive reviews on this site, and was really impressed by Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. From my first email and phone conversations, everyone was very pleasant and helpful (thanks, Demian and Sherri!) We were in the Coqui room - not ocean front but in a little cabana behind the main hotel. The landscaping is beautiful, and the room was perfect. Large and comfortable, with a spacious bath, private patio, and shared roof deck. (I assume, although I never saw anyone else up there.) On our first afternoon we explored the beaches and got lunch at the kioskos. For dinner we drove north of Fajardo, and wished we had booked a kayak tour of the bio-bay. After a great breakfast, the next day we checked out and headed over to El Yunque. We were able to leave our bags at the Inn. The 10:30 guided tour was booked, so we hiked down to La Mina falls and back, as well as a bit of the Mt. Britton trail before the 12:30 tour. Our guide Cynthia was great - very informative and fun. All highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: davidlove
Reviews.Content: We styed 4 nights and enjoyed it all. Very clean,friendly staff, great beaches and - surprise - wonderful retaurants within walking distance or a very short car ride.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: mbeerley1988
Reviews.Content: Oh My, Wonderful Location, Excellent staff they were so so helpful. The water is 100 feet away, Definitely reccomend Luquillo over San Juan for a Small island/Small town feel with all major attractions within an hour SO close to El Yunque Amazing local restaurants Definitely check out Pasta Y Pueblo right next door beach front open air surfer restaurant with way better food than the 5 star hotels for real this spot is to die for. The Coqui room is in the back and is listed as not beach front, but it really is their best room as it is a separate Villa behind the hotel with a private backyard and rooftop tanning deck plus the room is bigger for the same price. Everything about this place was perfect lke a dream come true Michael- Philadelphia

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, cheerful, cozy bed and breakfast in a small tropical beach town.”
Reviews.Author: Mathyou
Reviews.Content: The cheerful appearance of this bed and breakfast inn was accurately portrayed by the web site. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, nicely furnished and attractively decorated. The breakfast was served on a deck in close view of the beach. The view of the beach across the street was clear and unobstructed with the waterline approximately 100 feet from the grounds at high tide. There was some debris (tree limbs) on the beach from a recent storm, but the ocean was clean and the surf was enjoyable. The owner was on site and took a personal interest in seeing that everything was ok. This is an ideal place to stay for anyone wanting a small town atmosphere in a tropical beach environment.

Reviews.Title: “Computer Saved, thanks Sunrise.”
Reviews.Author: TexasBuffalo
Reviews.Content: After we left, they found my laptop and some other things which I left in my room. They took the effort to call my office in Texas to try to let me know. Their location, efforts and honesty caused us to come back and spend additional time with them rather than at other areas of the island. We had a wonderful time here. It looks over a beautiful beach and is near so many things without being a tourist trap. Great breakfast and smiles came with our room. We will not look for another place to say next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: djk123
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this no-frills hotel on TA and with the great reviews here, I booked a room. This small, quaint B&B is a perfect get-away close to Fajardo for the Bio-Bay, Yunke Ziplining, Kiosks, Luquillo Beach, not far from Old San Juan, close to the rain forest, and everything you might have planned to do on the east side of the Island. Rooms are small, but clean. It was great waking up each morning to a full view of the ocean as this hotel sits yards from a surfer's beach. Breakfast was great with fruits, breads, cakes, cereal, and one hot item each day. A good filler to get you through till lunch or even dinner. Service was great as well. The area around this place is run down but don't let that stop you from staying here. We walked around the area alot, and no one bothered us. The best place to eat is literally a stone throw away called Pasta Y Pueblo (a hut much like the kiosk) which was the best food we ate during our 5 days stay. They have a computer with Internet access, free of charge, a huge veranda where breakfast is served along with chaises, swings, and chairs just to lounge when you want to read a book for just enjoy the sun and sound of the ocean. Another safety factor is the parking lot which is enclosed in a locked gate at night so you don't have to worry about your vehicle. Inside each room is a "safe" with key to lock up all valuables while you're out and about. A nice hidden gem that's away from the touristy stuff, but yet close enough to it all without driving too far. The only down-fall I could find was the room doors slam very loudly when people come and go which can be annoying.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: ealane135
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the green room with our 10 and 14 year old. It was extremely clean. We loved the privacy of this unit. The yard was fantastic and a great place to relax (or chase lizards on the exterior walls). Breakfast was fantastic with a bounty of continental items plus a hot breakfast of the day was included in the room rate. No one will walk away hungry after breakfast. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. we don't have one negative thing to say about Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. We also took advantage of the Spread Eagle snorkeling trip. This was awesome and definitely the highlight of our adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kpjMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Place is right on beach. Surfer beach, so waves were big. Desk has boogie boards/snorkeling gear to rent. Breakfast included. Clean room, internet access. My teenagers loved the waves. Sherry and Demian, very knowledgable and helpful with directions, attractions and setting up tours. Best place in town. Beach is not crowded at all. Surfer shop right down street for board rental. Walgreen and grocery nearby. Not easy to find in dark. You will need a car.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xjfan
Reviews.Content: Not much to add from other reviews. Just wanted to chime in and say our experience was awesome. The review from everyone else was right on the money. The beach that across the street is ok but worth the drive to Balneario Luquillo, it's very close. This beach is the best. The kioskos are nearby and the food is to die for. It's a must. We stayed on both sides of the island and it was great being able to see the sunset at El Combate on the east and sunrise at Luquillo on the west. The service is great...very friendly, room was very clean and the breakfast....made to order. You owe it to yourself to check it out....

Reviews.Title: “Everything excellent-- town is a little sad and balcony too high to see anything while sitting (without phonebooks! :P)”
Reviews.Author: FroggerDC
Reviews.Content: The overall feel of this place is friendly and laid back. They are very eco-conscious. The proximity to the beach is nice. The town itself feels a little sad, though. I was a little diappointed that while sitting down on the balcony we couldn't see the beach (the ledge is high, so I'd have had to sat on phonebooks or something, and I'm about 5' 6"). I love balconies, and a large draw for me was the thought of sitting on the balcony, sipping a nice drink with my sweety, and watching the sunset/rise. No such luck. BUT they do have a lovely terrace where they serve breakfast (lots of yummy fruit!). One lady is originally Venezuelan and very friendly. She loves to chat with people, which is nice most of the time (except when there are people waiting in line to talk to her to check in/check out/ask a question...etc.). The room was nice-- clean and pretty, but nothing to set it apart from other good rooms. I'm just mostly bummed about the balcony!!

Reviews.Title: “great place right across from the beach”
Reviews.Author: TripsterBay
Reviews.Content: Luquillo Sunrise is a great place to stay. It's across from the ocean, and a short drive to El Yunque and the Bioluminescent bay. Breakfast was quite good. The surrounding neighborhood is a bit deserted at night, but we definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family hotel with exceptional service!”
Reviews.Author: Josunae
Reviews.Content: We are so thankful that we found this hotel! It's friendly, helpful staff really helped make our trip wonderful with great suggestions for activities, restaurants, and directions. It's not a "resort style" hotel, but that's not what we were looking for... we wanted quick beach access, clean rooms, and helpful service - and that's exactly what we got and more! Damian at the front desk helped us out tremendously. In fact, we originally had reservations at another hotel in the area which didn't work out... so at the last minute we called Luquillo (they'd been booked when I originally contacted them). Damian worked it out and was able to get us in, even though the hotel was booked pretty solidly for the entire week. The rooms are basic, but comfortable and clean. All of the rooms in the "main building" have a balcony looking out at the ocean (and what a great view it is!!) except for the two rooms on the ground floor. Even so, they're close to the ocean too! There is a building behind the main one which has around 4 - 5 rooms as well... and what they lack in ocean view is made up for by being extremely spacious and in a lovely garden setting. They're even "eco-friendly" rooms using solar power for a portion of their energy, if I'm remembering this correctly. We toured one that had a kitchen and living room, plus patio... it would be great for a family to spread out and really enjoy each other. The rate includes a nice hot breakfast with accompanying pastries, cereal, coffee / tea / juice ~ all served on the second floor terrace looking over the ocean. This is a great place to mingle with other guests, but you can also find your own quiet table. Much like a B&B experience. They have creative entrees that are brought to you personally, but the rest is self -serve. Otherwise, there is no on-site restaurant... nor is there much that's within walking distance. However, keep in mind that within a couple minutes' drive, there's the AMAZING collection of "kioskos" along the public beach! They have everything from a sit-down "nice" restaurant which takes credit cards, to sidle-up-to-the-bar pool table restaurants, to wonderful traditional Puerto Rican food stalls. It's a pleasant hour's walk along the beach from the hotel if you want to make an afternoon of it, or just a couple minutes in the car if you just can't wait. There's only one restaurant which takes credit cards (the first one at the far left) so remember to bring cash to those. The beach is wonderful, too! It's directly across the quiet otherwise residential street, and the hotel will offer chairs, towels and boogie boards. To the right is La Perla / the Wall where you will see surfers enjoying some nice surf. Beyond that by around a quarter mile is a long stretch of undeveloped, pristine beach which is a Turtle nesting ground at certain times of the year. To the left is a fantastic walk as well along 2 - 3 large coves with some hotels but still pretty unspoiled in places. Coral lines the shore, and after a nice walk you will come up to the kiosks on the main public beach. There you can rent equipment for various sporting events. While the hotel is in a quiet, pleasant neighborhood and you'll need a car to get around, it's centrally located along the northeast coast with quick access to the main roads east, west and south to all the main activities like the rain forest, snorkeling/scuba, and kayaking. In the town which surrounds the neighborhood you can find larger stores like Walgreens, etc for necessities you might have forgotten... but you're not at all stuck in a commercial zone once you're at the hotel. The hotel overall is an excellent value! We absolutely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “For the simple traveler”
Reviews.Author: daranaco
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for posh accommodations in a luxurious setting, this is not the hotel for you. If you're a simple traveler looking for a clean, hospitable place to stay on the beach in a path-less-traveled part of town, then this is the place! The hotel is located in a neighborhood. Directly across the street is a beautiful beach used by the locals. The nightlife in the area is lacking, so you'll need to drive to find things to do and places to eat. The room was clean. The breakfasts were wonderful. We loved staying at the Luquillo Sunrise. It fit our personality perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BREAKFAST, SERVICE & STAY”
Reviews.Author: motofreak
Reviews.Content: The service was the best I have experienced in a hotel. View was perfect! Breakfast was fantastic. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Thekvetches
Reviews.Content: We booked 10 days at this inn as well as 4 nites in a resort in San Juan. Our entire family misses and reminisces about our experience- which was merely a week ago! The staff was so warm and helpful, the rooms perfectly suited and affordable for a family with 3 children, and the price was right. Could not recommend this place enough! The glitz of the resort in San Juan paled to our experience in Luquillo- if the inn had a pool it would have been complete paradise. But, who can complain when the beach is right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wein2008
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. They set up each of our excursions (snorkeling, Vieques bio-bay) and gave us directions to El Yunque and helpful hints about where to dine. Rooms were a little spartan but very clean. Make sure to check out their website for deals/specials. People are correct in that beach out front is not for lounging. It's a surfer's beach. The Luquillo blue flag beach is a short car ride away and it's gorgeous! The surrounding neighborhood is a little run-down but safe. Overall, we had a very nice relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relax - for a price”
Reviews.Author: geothrm
Reviews.Content: Compared to the rooms, services, and amenities of other hotels in the San Juan area, the price here is outrageous. But you're not paying for that, you're paying for the view and proximity to the beach. Even though the beach in front of the hotel is not worth visiting, it is pretty. The rooms look cheap, but they are clean and furnished with the necessities. The atmosphere is casual and laid back, as are the staff, and free breakfast on the terrace is fresh and relaxing. Given the view and the atmosphere, it would almost be worth it, if there weren't constant reminders to turn off electrical devices (including A/C) if you leave the room. You would think, at these prices, you could keep your room cool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mdbrtravel
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. The staff at the hotel made us feel at home. They helped us arrange day trips that were really special events; exploring El Yunque rainforest, surfing, kayaking in a bioluminescent bay, snorkeling at Cayo Santiago. The beach at the hotel is beautiful. Our rooms were clean and very comfortable. We enjoyed starting our day with a delicious breakfast on the patio overlooking the ocean. If we have the opportunity to return to Puerto Rico, we will definitely stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: gojo5
Reviews.Content: The best part about the inn is the friendliness of the workers. They were upbeat and pleasant from our reservation on. They helped up make our Biobay reservation in advance (highly recommended). And sent us on our way to the Rainforest with map in hand. The breakfast was delicious on the relaxing terrace. And the offstreet parking was a plus. Our flight was late and we had to knock on the after hours door to get someone to unlock the gate and check us in, but this was no problem. My only one complaint was the bed, which lacked a box spring and was hard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, I will come back again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynndaliza
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, the host and service personnal is very very friendly and nice, the cleanliness was super good, the food was delicious, THE VIEW WAS WONDERFULL!!! Is one of the best inns that I could find ever!!! I really love it. I will come back everytime I visit the east zone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: finchyboo202
Reviews.Content: Seriously, everyone was really nice and the place was clean and secure. And they're green so that's a bonus. Close to many nearby attractions. Fantastic breakfasts, sunrise views from your window or their main balcony (complete with hanging hammock chairs), beach across the street, local flavor just steps away....what's not to like!?

Reviews.Title: “The Abso*Fantastic*Lutely Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: slackR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luquillo Sunrise last April (sorry for the review only now) for couple of days, at least 3 if I remember it right. We had a very nice room on the first floor, with the French door to a cozy balcony overlooking the ocean. We slept with the door open, listening to the ocean -- there's a road in front of a hotel but there's no traffic --- an absolutely serene place with amazing views. The rooms are clean & nice, showers working, and breakfasts -- prepare yourself for a treat! You can eat until you drop, everything delicious and home made, with enough choices to satisfy anyone ... and the stuff, probably the nicest people on earth. We are into local culture, surfing, and exploring and Luquillo Sunrise is da place to stay & see this part of the island. It is safe, comfortable, beautiful and quiet. We really liked it there, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ramblematt
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the inn. The main draw is any one of rooms on the 2nd or 3rd floor (which all have a private ocean view balcony). The rooms are spotless with post-card views, the sound of the surf and a steady breeze. Included is a daily hot breakfast with fresh fruit, juice, etc. Second is the outstanding staff. Sherrie, Damien, Maria, Heidi and Katie either know your "touristy" questions or know who to ask. I casually mentioned to Sherrie wanting to do a day trip to Culebra, and within minutes she had set everything up. If you're lucky Grace will be on the patio during breakfast, making jewelry. She is a fountain of local history. Third is location, location, location. You're in the middle of small, friendly town. You can walk to several restaurants, sandwich shops, a liquor/beer/ice store and a bakery. You can walk to a "blue" beach, a surfing beach and a wildlife preserve beach. You're a 5 minute drive from the kioskos. You're a 20 minute drive from El Yunque. (You HAVE to go...go early before the tour vans get there). We are alreday planning a January visit to be there for Three Kings. (PS: Get well Gary, watch out the ladders!)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: zagain
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we were not sure about it; but what a surprise we got when we checked in and spent a few days! The staff could not be more accomodating and personal; clean hotel, beautiful view of the ocean and very quiet, laid back and relaxing atmospheres just what we needed! I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking what we were above. Great entertainment at night at the bar down the street! Not to mention it is an excellent value! We'll be back soon! Millie & Pablo, Tampa, FL.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Safe, Fun!”
Reviews.Author: SurfColorado78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sunrise Luquillo for several days. The town itself is charming, full of local activity and color, it is across the street from a very pretty beach, and close to many great local restaurants serving a variety of cuisine. We were amazed by the check-in process. The staff accommodated us immediately even though we arrived 4 hours before check-in. We were given a great overview of the hotel, a map of town, restaurants, things to do, etc. In short - we felt very welcomed and had any questions answered. The hotel itself is in a great location, the secure parking is a plus. While the rooms are not fancy, they are clean, safe, and well appointed. The swimming out front is great as long as the swell isn't high. We stayed at Luquillo Sunrise to surf, and while the sets were 3-4 feet further out, my wife felt fine swimming in the water out front of the hotel. I would say that if you are staying during the winter when surf is higher, use a greater amount of caution or walk up the beach. Surfing is great - sandy bottom, waves aren't pushy, and great longboarding. No real localism either. Just give locals the respect they deserve, don't drop in on them, and you'll be fine. Breakfast is outstanding, service is prompt, and we felt very welcome. Since it is included with the room (i.e. a Bed and Breakfast), we felt this was a great value. Finally, the rooms are quiet at night, and the road traffic definitely accommodates beachgoers.

Reviews.Title: “Bewildered by tremendous reviews”
Reviews.Author: jahausa
Reviews.Content: I am not quite sure if I am just too picky, but I really did not feel this place warranted the consistent 5 out of 5 ratings most people were giving it. First the pros: - Fantastic hot breakfast. This is worth repeating - fantastic. - Well manicured grounds on the property itself. - Free, private gated parking. - Very nicely furnished, maintained and designed rooms. Ours was in the back, but it was very large. Now the cons: - Neighborhood was sketchy. Now we were there Easter week, one of the busiest for locals. I didn't mind the noise or the revelry, though, I don't mind being around people having a good time. But the area was...run down. Ugly houses tightly packed, most with bars needed for security, some looking abandoned. Not really a place I would want my wife walking at night alone. Think a seedy part of Daytona or Myrtle Beach. If that's not redundant. - Beach right across the street was very pretty from the balcony (where breakfast is served). But the beach itself was crummy, littered with garbage and not recommended for swimming. You have to walk a good 1/4 to 1/2 mile (or more) west to get to the nicer beaches, and the famous Luquillo public beach was even further. - We stayed in a room in the back - no view. The views looked super. But with no view, this place loses its charm fast. So bottom line - the hotel does the best it can with the space and location it has. But it has too many obstacles outside its control to fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like it at all”
Reviews.Author: traveltam65
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say the staff here was so nice I feel bad writing this. We stayed in the two bedroom apartment. It was VERY outdated. The bathroom need major work!! I could not wait to get home in my own bed and shower in my own shower. Some of my family stayed in the 1 bedroom rooms. These rooms were redone and much better than the apartment with a great veiw. The breakfast was great every morning also. There was no pool for the kids. they love the ocean though. All I can say if you stay here do NOT get the apartment, get two rooms!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: fvandewouwer
Reviews.Content: Can recommend this to anyone We stayed here 2 days before and after a cruise. If you would like to explore a bit of Puerto Rico and want a quiet and cozy b&b with a great location, This is the place. From our reservation, until we left it was all perfectly arranged. Staff : kind, helpful and knowledgeable. Service : outstanding Breakfast : more than you can eat, fresh made, every morning something else. Location : biobay and El Yunque almost at your doorstep and Just a 45 min drive from San Juan Rooms : spacious and clean and so quiet Could have stayed much longer, thank you all for making us feel like home. Best greetings from Belgium Frieda and Erwin Brigitte and Dirk

Reviews.Title: “Great value and central location for day trips”
Reviews.Author: Presto2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first two days in PR. Good location for day trips to the public beach and hiking in the rainforest. I would not recommend staying here without a car since most attractions are well over a mile away from the hotel, although there are a couple of restaurants within a reasonable walking distance of the hotel. Breakfast is served at the hotel and certainly surpassed by expectations. Staff was very knowledgable and helpful throughout our stay and provided good recommendations for things to do near the hotel (try the "lizard walk" along the beach to the east o fthe hotel). The beach in front of the hotel had heavy surf while we were there and was not suitable for swimming - or even surfing unless you have serious experience with high-surf conditions. Public beach and Kiosks, located a short drive to the west of the hotel, and hiking in the rainforest inland are well worth a tourist's time.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B”
Reviews.Author: simonie83
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for visiting rainforest or luquillo beach. Room was clean and pretty spacious. Had a great view of the beach across the street. Pretty decent breakfeast selection with hot meal cooked as well. From what i could tell this seemed to be the nicest place to stay at around and was packed while we where there for three nights. Great location for visiting rainforest and luquillo beach area. Wasnt to impressed with the town of luquillo itself however this place i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingfamily2
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our Puerto Rico vacation. As part of our vacation was a 2 night stay at Luquillo Sunrise B/B. We were warmly greeted and given an introduction to the amenities of the inn and of the local area. The rooms are amazingly spotless. The oceanfront view is breathtaking. We slept each night with the balcony door open, receiving the ocean air and breeze. The morning breakfast was served on the 2nd floor oceanfront patio. Plenty of fruit, cereals, bread, coffee, and juice (we loved the passion fruit juice) and then came the hot meal- cooked as you ordered it. We can't wait to plan our next visit. Don't forget to visit the kioskos - La Parilla was great - we ate dinner there twice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: day2day
Reviews.Content: Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn is the perfect small beach inn. Our room was clean and comfortable. Our favorite part was being lulled to sleep each night by the surf. The breakfast each morning was excellent and it was nice why to meet fellow travelers. The staff at the Inn were helpful and friendly. They sincerely wanted you to have a nice vacation. Beaches in the area are excellent and have something to offer everyone. There are plenty of restaurant in the area. Here are the ones we tried: El Jefe Burger Shack: known for their burgers, but the fish sandwich is excellent too. The famous Luquillo kiosks where a disappointment, but El Jefe was worth the stop. La Estacion: Excellent! Great grilled meats with a wonderful outdoor setting. Best meal we had in PR. Calizos: Good seafood, a little pricey. Lolita's: Surprisingly good Mexican food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Introduction to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Pyxisgirl
Reviews.Content: We initially had a tricky time finding a place to stay in or near San Juan, both because we were on a "starving artists" budget and also because we didn't really want to stay in some big corporate high-rise. That said, there are things that are definitely important to us in a vacation spot - cleanliness, great staff, a great view, fun things to do, and a room and locale that relaxes instead of stresses. Luquillo Sunrise Inn has all of these things and plenty more. After several very helpful emails back and forth with Luquillo's staff, we arrived to be greeted by Sherri and Maria, and given an abundance of info about the hotel amenities and more info and maps about the surrounding area. Our room, although we'd looked at photos online, was definitely a surprise, in that it exceeded its online description and appearance, and was so extremely, meticulously clean, from the crisp linens to the spotless tables and chairs! The room itself was roomy and breezy, and the balcony was so large it was like having an entire additional small room to hang out in - this one with a terrific palms-and-ocean view. We left our screenless balcony door open most of the time we were in the room - and for those of you with a fear of bugs, rest assured that we didn't see a single bug during our entire stay. (I know - we couldn't believe it, either!) The breezes were great. The bath area was nicely equipped with toiletries, tissues, coffee maker and supplies, and towels, and although we'd read "complaints" about the water pressure, it was perfectly fine to us, and the shower was very roomy and beautifully tiled in rich brown tones, with louvred windows to air out the bath. The floors in the main room and balcony were tiled, too, which helped keep everything nice and cool and tidy. There are no phones in the rooms (we didn't care, as our cell phones worked just fine), although there is TV, which we didn't use either, except to muddle our way past several unwanted satellite stations in order to check the Weather Channel a couple of times. The decor is simple, kind of modern-island - not overdone, not particularly dated, just very streamlined, appropriate to the setting, perfectly comfortable, and very nicely kept up by the room attendants/maids. Anything we asked for was promptly and politely brought up with a smile. We spent three nights at Luquillo, and let me just say that three nights - while we were grateful for them - was way too short! Our first day, we arrived in the afternoon, unpacked, gazed at the view from our room for a while, and then ate dinner at Guava's, which is just down the block from the Inn; the food was very good and presented beautifully (especially the Guava cheesecake, their signature dessert!), and our waiter Jimmie was also super friendly and attentive, although the bar atmosphere didn't really live up to the great food and service. The rest of the evening we just enjoyed the Inn itself; it's hard to explain unless you've been there, but the relaxed atmosphere and island ambiance combined with the security of the property (we'd read reports on Luquillo being "dangerous" at night, but never felt that way) and the gorgeous views made it the perfect place to just hang out and rest after our long flight. The second day, we enjoyed the Inn's top-notch breakfast service; plenty of fresh fruit and breads, coffee, sweet juice, and a hot entree made to order by the also friendly kitchen staff. Then we drove over to El Yunque for a full day of hiking - highly recommended (it reminded us of the foliage of Jurassic Park or the TV show "Lost"), especially on weekdays when it is said to be less crowded. The only downside to El Yunque was that parts of it were a bit too touristy for us, but that element is easily avoided by sticking to the less-busy trails and finding your own way up the mountain. The second night, we visited the famed Luquillo food kioskos, and especially enjoyed #12, El Jefe Burger Shack (recommended by the Inn's staff) where we had very good "slider" mini-burgers and had fun talking to their waiters and meeting the El Jefe resident cat, Mocha; we also wandered down the row of kioskos, and made another great find in #8 (forgot the name, but it's something "Sylvia"), where we chatted in our meager Spanish with the lady cook and watched her use a leaf to deftly fold over the flour casing for the delicious crab and carne empanadillas that ended up being one of our favorite foods during our visit. The third day, with great directions given to us by the Inn's Demian, we drove over to Old San Juan, where we promptly got turned around in the narrow streets and eventually called upon the friendly local police to direct us to a parking garage (our minimal Spanish came in handy again at this point!) Once in Old San Juan, we especially liked St. Germain Cafe, where we had an amazingly good lunch and fun conversation with the manager and wait staff, and we also had a blast at both the El Morro and San Cristobal forts, which were impressive overviews of San Juan history and also very cool photo ops. Our final day, Demian was kind enough to extend our checkout time for an hour so we could explore the beaches in front of the hotel (a mere 50 feet or so away); we checked out a couple of complimentary towels, and wandered up and down the shoreline, where we met a couple of local fishermen and just enjoyed our last few hours in Puerto Rico. True, there is no on-site restaurant or pool at Luquillo Sunrise Inn (save the more than adequate breakfast service); but unless those are things that are necessary to your particular vacation, you'll never miss them. The Inn might not be best for kids, who will probably not find enough to do at the Inn itself; but for experienced travelers, those who appreciate a more local feel to their accommodations, or those looking for a place that offers a high level of personalized customer service and pretty surroundings at a more than fair price, Luquillo Sunrise Inn is a hidden gem that we would definitely recommend. Thanks to all at the Inn for our wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise- in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: EvalynVan
Reviews.Content: I was calling around looking for a place to sleep on our way to Vieques when I found Sherry, of Luquillo Sunrise Beach. We needed something temporary and inexpensive, but were hoping for some local charm. Sherry ended up helping us to plan our overall trip by giving us tips and contact info on El Yunque, car rentals and even arranging our ferry tickets for us. We arrived after dark and were pleasantly surprised by the attractive room decor, but the view from our bed at dawn took my breath away. This was followed by an elegant omelet breakfast on the patio that we hadn't realized was included in the price! We were unable to meet Sherry due to the timing of our stay so I decided the best way to thank her for the time she spent on our ferry tickets would be to reciprocate my time on a heartfelt review. Thank you, Sherry. -Evalyn

Reviews.Title: “Luquillo Sunrise is the perfect inn!”
Reviews.Author: JollieTravels
Reviews.Content: Although at first I was attracted to the larger resort-style places to stay on the island, I am so glad we chose to stay at small family-run inns, most especially the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful! If you are used to staying in gated-off mega hotels, the location may not seem ideal at first. However, the neighborhood is extermely safe and all of the people are nice and helpful. We even were able to walk from the Inn to several restaurants for dinners. Some recommendations: - Rent a car and explore the area!! You'll be able to walk to a surfing beach and a swimming beach, and if you'd like to take a long walk you can get to the Balneareo (public bathing beach), however you can get to some great places for day trips and for dinner and lunch with a rental (i.e., San Juan, Fajardo, ferrys to outer islands, etc.) - I recommend reading over the restaurant review book in the Inn's office room to find great places to dine and even activities. Some of our favorites: Parillo (in the Kioskos), El Jefe Burger Shack (also a Kiosko), La Estacion (***** absolute favorite, a bit of a drive toward the El Conquistador resort). Guavas is the closest to the hotel, and the food was perfectly fine, however it was not one of our favorites (bar atmosphere doesn't match up with the more modern food). It is, however, a good place to grab a drink or take in the live music (which we missed each night we tried, so can't comment on). - Don't skip the breakfast! There's a great continental breakfast daily along with a "hot special" that changes every morning so you don't tire of it. Everyday's was delicious. If you're heading out for an early ferry or excursion, be sure to tell the breakfast ladies, they will insist you grab a plate of fruit and breads or a glass of fresh juice for the road!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Luquillo Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: MyValentine2004
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the B&B, the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn, we were blown away. To say that this place is immaculate would be an understatement. Everything looked great from the parking lot swept free of sand, to the rooms with new tile floors, showers and granite countertops, to the activity room with internet station, games, books and notebooks full of reviews of local restaurants, activities and more. What a great idea! We relied heavily on those review books when deciding where we wanted to eat. The front desk and support staff are all friendly and helpful. The B&B also serves a great breakfast, with Continental items like breads and bagels with fruit and cereal and hot options that change every day. We had an amazing view and the location near the beach, the rainforest and the marinas was great. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “just what we neded!!”
Reviews.Author: treefreak
Reviews.Content: i can only repeat what others have stated. usually i do not write a review when others have already said what i experienced, but having had such a wonderful time, i feel i need to say this, too. first of all, we always vacation in the luquillo/rio mar area, but this was our first time not in a large resort. the b&b experience was very different and we loved it. the staff was personable and helpful, but didn't act like they were doing this because it was their job.breakfasts were family style on the balcony which helped us to meet the other people staying there and exchange ideas about restaurants and day trips. the food, by the way was delicious and presented in a warm, friendly manner. the rooms were large and breezy as well as well-kept. the scenery from the balcony was worth waking up to in the morning. beaches were as near as across the street, or if it was too breezy, a short walk up the beach to the left brought you to quieter waters and secluded beaches. can't say enough about this trip. our 4 nights here were delightful for us(58 years old) and both of our married children and their spouses (25-32 years old). steve

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little inn”
Reviews.Author: Blockislander
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights in Puerto Rico and four of those nights were at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. We highly recommend it for vacationers looking for a clean, well-maintained, well-managed inn at a reasonable price. The staff is wonderful--absolutely committed to helping you have a great vacation. The inn is located across the street (more like a lane, since cars pass at a rate of about three an hour) from the surfing beach, so you go to sleep lulled by the sound of breaking waves. Itâ€™s a short walk to a good swimming beach or you can hop in your car for a quick drive to the full facility public beach (we never did go the car route). While we were there we spent a day hiking in the rain forest and a day on a snorkeling trip. The catamaran â€œSpread Eagleâ€�recommended by the inn provided a superior day of sailing and snorkeling; we would recommend is highly. Dining information given by the staff was very accurate, so we could reliably choose a restaurant and not be surprised by our experience. We loved the Flamboyan Cafe for an inexpensive lunch and had a phenomenal dinner at La Estation restaurant in Fajardo. Wherever you stay in this area, be sure to eat at that restaurant. It was the only place we found yellow tail on the menu! they served it with green papaya salad, and it was yummy. One final comment: breakfast is served on the covered terrace, and table sizes allow for different preferences. There are tables for two, four and six, plus a long table for folks who want to meet fellow travelers. Another way of sharing information is â€œ The Notebooks â€œ, one for restaurants, the other for tours, taxis, and general advice. These notebooks are left out for guests to share their experiences (good and bad) with other guests. Note: I feel a little guilty giving this resort a rating of "above average" rather than "excellent". For us it was truly excellent. It has defined its niche and executes on an "excellent" level. However, I don't want to mislead the folks who are looking for a glitzy establishment. If that is what you think excellent is, you need to look someplace else. This is an inn. It is not a resort. There are no cabana boys bringing you drinks and no spa to get your seaweed wrap. Final thought as I sit here in cold New England: O can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: chphmusic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely B&B in Jan 2009. Very clean and well maintained property. We stayed a week. It was so relaxing, peaceful and quiet. Full complementary breakfast that were a wonderful start to a perfect day. Close to the Rainforest. Nice beaches. They arranged a trip to Vieques to the Biolumenescent Bay (Mosquitto Bay) which was absolutely wonderful! Old San Juan with the cobbled streets is a must. Aricibo, if you love science, is great! We loved everything about our stay! Once couldn't ask for nicer hosts!

Reviews.Title: “Return visit !!”
Reviews.Author: ERMESR
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit and we were equally delighted with everything - we met the owners who were there finishing up the new "green" eco-unit which was very impressive. Same great service, same great location close to a Luquillo Beach, El Yunque, ferry service to Culebra/Vieques, and a nature reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Michiganfamily4
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Luquillo Sunrise Inn for two nights - we had the 2-BR apartment - and loved it. It was convenient to get to the catamaran cruises out of Fajardo, the rainforest, and was right on the beach! We had a full kitchen and a covered patio as well. The management is friendly and the breakfasts (included) were great. There's a shopping area with a grocery nearby, too, which is good for saving a bit of money since the restaurants in PR aren't cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Agree With All The Other Reviews--A Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: DonH
Reviews.Content: All I can do is echo all the previous reviews. This is a wonderful place to stay! The staff is outstanding--friendly, responsive, and helpful. Breakfasts are delicious. We appreciated the Internet access. I walked to the town square at night (took a photo of the town hall lit up for Christmas) and we were also there during the day and didn't feel unsafe at any time. We also liked the notebooks with previous guests' comments on tours and restaurants--extremely helpfu! We liked Guava's (but don't go on a night when the upstairs is closed unless you like LOUD music), La Estacion, and Boracuba restaurants, and a Mexican restaurant about 3 miles down the road towards Fajardo (sorry, forgot the name). The bakery in town makes excellent sandwiches, and Erik's is a great place for Greek food (as our guidebook said, "feta in the Caribbean!"). The gyros were outstanding! We also liked the convenient location--close to a supermarket, and the highway to San Juan or the east coast, but far enough away to be out of earshot from highway noise. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for beaches and El Yunque”
Reviews.Author: takojin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luquillo for three nights in early November and were very pleased with our experiece. Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was a great value. Everything good that others stay was spot on regarding our experience: excellent customer service; wonderful views of the beach; clean, comfortable, well-maintained rooms. While there, we explored El Yunque, enjoyed the evening kayak trip in the Fajardo bio-bay (arranged with the hotel staff's assistance) and enjoyed snorkeling within walking distance of the hotel. I didn't think the breakfasts were especially exciting, but it was nice to have fresh fruit in the morning; the hot selection varied from day to day, but not especially impressive. We would return to Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn and recommend to others, including couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront location in small-town PR”
Reviews.Author: NaptownJetSet
Reviews.Content: We were very happy we opted for the Luquillo after considering other options in the area, like Ceiba Country Inn (which is much farther from both beaches and El Yunque). Location was perfect: across a very quiet street from rolling surf and short walk (3 blocks) from swimming beach; 10 minute drive to both Luquillo's main (and somewhat overrated) beach and the entrance to El Yunque rain forest park; 20 minutes to Fajardo port from which kayak tours of bioluminescent bay depart (and equally close to Fajardo's excellent La Estacion restaurant). This place truly has the feel of a bed-and-breakfast, and in fact comes with a decent breakfast (frozen waffles one day disappointed, but were followed by excellent omelets the next). Staff could not have been more courteous or helpful with directions and advice on local activities. Rooms were spartan but comfortable enough (especially for the price). This place is well worth the money and definitely worth leaving San Juan to spend a night or two near the local activities and to get the feel for a relatively small town. There are no other hotels here and only 3 high-rise condos. But there is access to a supermarket, drug store, and a few decent restaurants and bars, which mostly cater to locals. We had a good meal at Guavas, just down the street, the only restaurant in walking distance of a hotel that is essentially located in a residential neighborhood. Overall, we very much enjoyed spending time in the area and would highly recommend the Luquillo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... OK location...”
Reviews.Author: AKFromColorado
Reviews.Content: Firstly -- the B/B itself is worth the trip. The rooms, cleanliness, staff, and food were all great. They provide everything you could possibly need, plus a lot of tender loving care. Sersiously -- the staff at the hotel is exceptional. The rooms are big, great views in the morning. Clean... no complaints at all about the B/B itself. The location was a bit disconcerting however, and to me at least, unexpected. 1 - the beach in front of the hotel is NOT accessible to swimmers, or bery good for sunbathing. It is a small beach, with rip tides and very rough surf. (Great for surfing, but not much else). 2 - The other walkable beach was unexceptional. However there is a gorgeous, well kept Blue-flag beach about 30 minutes walking (5 minutes driving). 3 - The location immediately South of the hotel was, well, sketchy ... I've taken the NYC subway through Harlem and Brooklyn at night, we negotiated San Juan at night without a hint of fear... but the neighborhood to the south was a handful of buildings about 1/2 of which appeared completely abandonded. There were literally more stray dogs than people for a few blocks. And the people we did see, were the ONLY people on the island who were not overwhelmingly friendly. Just taken aback. I do not KNOW if the area is unsafe. It just made me feel unsafe. As long as you have a car, and don't wander around alone at night, I'm positive it is safe... just less than expected. I wonder if a recent Hurricaine left it this way -- which would be very sad, but without explanation, it was a bit creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Clean, Safe, Great View, Wonderful Staff, Romanic”
Reviews.Author: sher777bear
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It was a quick 40 minute ride away from busy San Juan and a wonderful memory for us both. We were so surprised to find such a clean, well taken care of, safe oasis with a fantastic view, in such a secluded area. It was great to hang out with the locals and not be surrounded by tourists. The rooms were quaint, and the staff were so helpful. Breakfast was always a treat, including breakfast burritos to pancakes, fresh fruit and guava juice and GREAT coffee. It was so romanitc leaving our patio door open at night to hear the crashing waves!! Snorkeling so close by, and great local (inexpensive) restaurants to choose from gave us everything we needed for an awesome holiday. A little knowledge in Spanish would have been helpful, and quicker internet, but besides that, fabulous!!! The parking was safe too, with the opperated gates, and we found inexpensive rent a car. We dont reccomend traveling around the island, staying local was the best. It was so quick to just pop over to San Juan for the day and enjoy the great rates in Laquillo at night. We bought a beautiful mask in the lobby by a local artist which was nicer than much of tourist attractions shops. Bakery - Deli around the corner was great and cheap! Kiosk was fun for local treats and a wonderful Pina Colada served in a bamboo cup with bamboo straw. Too fun! Locals are very friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Must return!”
Reviews.Author: poprocks
Reviews.Content: The Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was a last minute addition to our 8-day trip to Puerto Rico, but we wish we had planned to stay longer. The staff was helpful and friendly, the room was immaculate and comfortable, the breakfast was decent, and the location can't be beat if you are doing day trips or going to the beach. You can throw a rock and hit the surf, which means sleeping to the sound of surf (something we love). The neighborhood may seem a little dicey, but the Inn is safe and a great place to stay. It's walking distance to several restaurants and the community's plaza. It's about 20 minutes to El Yunque Rain Forest, 5 minutes to Luquillo beach for swimming, and an easy drive to San Juan. We'll stay here again, but much longer!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous B&B by Beach”
Reviews.Author: rozkramer
Reviews.Content: The staff was very kind and knew everything about the area. The breakfasts were especially good, internet access is free, all the local restaurants are within walking distance and they also provide reviews of places to see, eat, snorkel, dive, etc. Can't say enough good about this special place. Walk about 100 yards to the beach without waves or across the street to the beach for surf! Parking is no problem - and it's very safe. The local people are really nice and it's totally safe. Everyone speaks enough English to be understood and most speak it perfectly, so no worries. Price was excellent and so worth it. The rooms are spacious enough with plenty of storage, good water pressure, ice is available down the hall, beds comfy, A/C perfect, staff cleaned room very nicely. Recommend having a car to go to El Yunque but staff could arrange any tours you want to go on. We would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality and Beachy Charm”
Reviews.Author: JosephineKoz
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Inn. Damien, an employee there, was so helpful from beginning to end and so friendly. The place is right on the beach -- every room is beachfront. Because of the tradewinds, we were able to sleep with our door open so we could fall asleep to the sound of the ocean and the breakfast was DELICIOUS. The only problem is that there isn't much to do in Luquillo (if you want to call that a problem). Walk down to the beach to the left and it's like a secluded beach down there. Don't miss out on the bioluminescent lagoon in Fajardo or hiking up to the top of El Yunque. Luquillo Sunrise Inn, though, is a great jumping off place for anything you want to do on the east coast .

Reviews.Title: “Such a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lwv2101
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I absolutely loved this hotel!! The room was super comfortable, with fridge, microwave, safety cupboard, great shower, cute balcony and a very nice view of the beach. We were not expecting much from this hotel as it is located in a neighborhood in Luquillo I was a little concerned about. The neighborhood turned out to be 'ok' but the Inn has a gate. The only complaint we had was that we had an issue with our AC not wanting to shut off and it being FREEZING in our room. When we went to find hotel staff at 9pm we couldn't locate anyone by phone or by knocking on doors. If it had been a security issue I would have been concerned but things seemed to be safe. The best part was breakfast!! The common area/balcony where breakfast is served was really nice and had an amazing view of the beach. The breakfast was great and much better than I expected with a variety of fresh fruit, a different hot breakfast choice each day and fresh juice/coffee/tea, bagels and toast also available. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was very very friendly and had great suggestions for things to do in the area. You can rent snorkel stuff, but do be cautious about the quality before renting it. We even went back to the hotel on a rainy day after we checked out and they were helping us figure out new plans since our tours got rained out. This was an amazing find and a great price for rooms, we would love to go back here any time.

Reviews.Title: “My Happy Place”
Reviews.Author: ciciryder
Reviews.Content: This Place is the best all of the rooms have an ocean view, which is not hard to accomplish because the ocean is literally across the street They also all have balconies. It is small but I think that makes it better The staff is super freindly and the owners even had breakfast with the guest. There is a great common room which extends onto a patio which is where breakfast is served. I don't even know what to say except this is the place to stay it was perfect. There are no phones in the rooms but if you ask to use the one at the front desk they do not mind at all. Loved it and plan to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adored this place”
Reviews.Author: lov2trvlMn
