Reviews.Content: Even before we arrived the staff was very helpful, pleasant and accommodating. When we arrived we saw exactly what we had seen on their web site. The atmosphere was perfect, very clean, very well kept, cozy, romantic, the greatest ocean view, the cooked complementary breakfasts were delicious and service with a big smile. All the staff was more than willing to go out of their way to make our stay everything we expected and hoped for. There is a nice room where a computer can be used for your convenience. You can also find just about everything you want about the area from the information wall, there are also folders and notebooks of comments and experiences from past guest. Which we found to be quite helpful. They have a small gift shop right at the office. You can also rent a boogie board for all day at a very reasonable rate with instructions on how to use it! There is a snorkeling area just a few blocks away and when you are done with that follow the path next to the river to see the iguanas in the trees! This area offers so much more than the other side of the island. We stayed in Rincon in April of 08 and didn't make it over to the rain forest. We were so glad we took the trip back to see that and worth it. The rain forest is only about a 10 minute drive from the hotel. There are many things to do with in a short drive. A short walk away, you will find the best food anywhere in Puerto Rico at Guavas. There you will find the best sea food you will ever taste. On the outside and inside you will find this place to be very clean with a good atmosphere but you wouldnâ€™t expect to get a fine dining experience because of the bar and grill like appearance. The entrees come out with a beautiful professional presentation, almost a work of art! The taste was truly exceptional that woke up and pleased every taste bud in your mouth. I should also mention the PiÃ±a Coladas were the best and made to perfection! Here you will also find island night life. With great salsa music, singing, and dancing! Guavaâ€™s prices are very comparable to the other sea food places in town but 100 million times better, donâ€™t be fooled! Go to Guavaâ€™s first then eat the same thing down the road and taste the difference, Guavas will win hands down every time! The staff is nothing less than excellent and very accommodating. We will miss eating the best crab cakes on earth! Guavas is an experience in itself. Our stay was nothing less than excellent and all we could have hoped for. I can't say enough about the personably, friendly, helpful staff that made us feel at home and welcome. We couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Last but not least the price is nothing less than perfect. We would never stay anywhere else, and highly recommend this hotel to everyone. No matter what class you are, you could find something that would you would appreciate and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: thehoneymooner101
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful - quiet, clean, well kept and the best staff around. The location was perfect - right on the beach and every room has a view of the water. Within walking distance of several great restaurants. The hotel and rooms are very clean, comfortable and well kept. The staff are very helpful and friendly. It was better than we expected. We would go back again - several times!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis with a view”
Reviews.Author: Lv2Trvl
Reviews.Content: As 2 women traveling alone for the first time in Puerto Rico we were a little hesitant about our trip, especially travelling outside of San Juan. We found Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn to be a haven for us. The English speaking staff at the hotel was extremely helpful with our plans and driving directions. We felt very safe in this hotel and ventured out walking even after dark to restaurants in the area. While this was no luxury hotel it was clean and well maintained. Breakfast was fresh and hot. Lots of little extras like beach towels, snorkeling equipment and bottled water were available right at the hotel office. The tiny town of Luquillo was a nice respite from staying in San Juan as we did on our first night in Puerto Rico. Luquillo was very convenient to San Juan, Fajardo and El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: illuminate01
Reviews.Content: I booked this inn based on all the great reviews and I have to say that I wasn't let down. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My family actually stayed in A2, the apartment. It originally was the house that the inn was built upon. It is not new but has 2 bedrooms, kitchen and a living room with a giant patio. For the 6 of us (2 kids, my parents, husband and I) this was exactly what we needed. No where near fancy, but very clean and comfortable. We were coming from the Gran Melia and I can tell you we were VERY happy to have left (bad service and food). Upstairs has a great little area for computer use and books that previous guests write in. We used this for dinner ideas and tried some very good places! My son found a pail and shovel to use (how thoughtful of them) and you could also rent snorkel and boogie boards. It is very close to El Yunque, Fajardo, Luquillo Beach and Kiosks and just a great location overall. We felt very safe walking around the area to the bakery and the ice cream shop with Walmart, Amigo grocery close by. Do not hesitate booking this great little place. We will go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: BEACHFOLKS77
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place to stay right across the street from the beach. The staff is friendly and courteous, always there to answer your questions. Close to El Yunque and Fajardo with easy access. We loved this hotel and staff, would recommend to anyone looking for a smaller non-resort hotel with knowledgeable staff. The breakfasts are pretty good too :). The room balconies and common balcony offer amazing beach views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen61C
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for six nights and loved it!! The rooms were clean and comfortable....the balcony had great views and the breakfast every morning was a plus!! The surrounding neighborhood driving into the hotel is a bit run down but don't let that deter you!! The only thing I didn't like was having to pay extra for a small refrigerator which you don't even really need as you can check out a cooler at the front desk. I will definately go back!!

Reviews.Title: “P.R trip 2008”
Reviews.Author: mini02
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful!! The rates were fair and average; the rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly and bilingual, which was helpful to my parents. The staff at the desk was always willing to provide directions to the different local sites and very helpful with all of our needs. Breakfast every morning was great - beach side! We originally were going to stay 3 day's but returned a day later to stay the remainder of our trip for another four day's. It was paradise on the beach! And we must mention the fabulous restaurant down the street within walking distance called Guava's. Great food and a wonderful safe walk back alongside the ocean. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A Local's Delight”
Reviews.Author: Finniky_Frank
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Luquillo and was really impressed by this new hotel that just recently opened. It's right across the street from the famous "La Pared" surfbreak. I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good place to stay outside of San Juan. The have an internet cafe, which worked great for keeping up with emails, complimentary breakfasts every morning with fresh papaya, mango, parcha, muffins, quesitos, juice, cafe con leche, etc... As for services provided, this was everything I wanted - they had beach towels and beach chairs we could check out to walk across the street with, they would do your laundry if you asked them to, there was an outdoor shower to rinse off with, etc... Also, the information on all the local attractions was spot on. I used to live in Luquillo so I was pleased to see they were giving the local scoop to tourists. The hotel was clean, safe, and very relaxing - the air conditioning was quiet, we had a balcony over looking the water but also found it nice to lounge about in the hammocks on the community balcony next to the kitchen. Give me a shout if you need further convincing!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ams777
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple days while visiting el Yunque and had a wonderful stay! The staff were extremely nice and friendly and we loved the breakfast with the other guests in the morning. The location was a nice change from the downtown San Juan area as it was much quieter at night and you could just relax and listen to the ocean and the coqui (frogs).

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our wildest dreams!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loving_life67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to treat ourselves to a treat to celebrate our 20th anniversary. Friends had recommended Puerto Rico for fun at a good price, so we set out to do our own bookings for hotels and activities. For three days of our eight day stay we selected Lequillo Sunrise Beach Inn. The price was excellent and the website had us sold. When we arrived we were awestruck by a spectacular location on the Atlantic side. The waves were continuously crashing on the beach and a warm breeze never, I mean, never stopped blowing in from the sea. We were greeted by the most friendly of staff who were very helpful and easy going. They showed us to our comfortable and clean room. The place was magic in our eyes. The inn is kept spotlessly clean and it is easy to see the great care that is given to keeping all aspects of the inn in top notch shape. The parking area was gated and we felt very safe leaving our rental car there. Lequillo itself is a bit rundown. The short drive from the main highway to the inn will show that. However, we never felt unsafe. The people we saw and spoke with along the way were beyond friendly. One night we went down the street to Guaves for dinner and walked back on the sidewalk and beach. Again it was like a dream. The wind was blowing and the waves crashing. A group of guys had gathered on the sidewalk with their various drums and they were playing like there was no tomorrow. We enjoyed the free performance. Further down the beach we watched a couple who had just pulled their car over to the sidewalk, turned up the music a bit, and were practicing their latino dancing in the warm, humid evening moonlight. This seemed like the Puerto Rico we came to see and experience. Our hosts were wonderful and usually shared in the breakfast with us each morning on the patio.... again overlooking the Atlantic. Fresh fruit, delicious coffee and usually a hot cooked main course awaited us each morning. Damien was a staff member who stands out as being particularly amazing. He always was their to help (did he ever go home?). He gave us the best recommendations for local eateries and activities. As a matter of fact, we had our best cheeseburgers ever at L'estacion.... and we are from New York!!!! We will definitely be coming back here and can recommend this place for all.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a romantic get away! amazing service”
Reviews.Author: jxntourist
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone, My husband and I loved our stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Inn! From the outside, we were a bit skeptical about the hotel. However, once we entered, we were greated with an extremely friendly staff and a room with a great view of the beach. They also provide you with towels and chairs for the beach (which is right across the street from the inn). During the first night I got some wierd kind of heat rash and the staff was really helpful in directing us to nearby farmacies and offering some temporary medication to relieve the my symptoms. The breakfast is also good (warm breakfast is included with your stay). We were undecided between this inn and a hotel in fajardo because we were going to go to culebra and thought that the fajardo hotel would be better because it's closer to the marina. However, the luquillo sunrise inn is not far from the marina at all. There is also this great restaurant called guavas up the street from the inn. They served the best food we had in puerto rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jeaniliz15
Reviews.Content: It is a great place to stay. Real quiet, clean and the breakfast is great. The people that work there is very nice and helpful. Defenetly I will come back again. Everything is very conveniencie, all the stores and restaurants are near to it. The beach it beatiful across from it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great”
Reviews.Author: BostonLegal
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, when I pulled into the Luquillo area with my friends I was not expecting pleasant accommodations. This was back to school week in Puerto Rico so Luquillo was very quiet, and a lot of businesses were closed. Had there been more people around, perhaps my expectations would have been different. The hotel is in great shape. It has a gated parking lot and is well lit. Locals seemed to go out of their way to tell us to be careful at night so this was an important feature. The room was very clean, with nice showers, fresh towels, and helpful information on local activities. The staff at the hotel was incredibly helpful. They provide beach chairs and towels free of charge and are more than willing to assist with whatever comes up, including discounts on activities through preferred providers. The free breakfast on the veranda every morning was a nice touch. Enjoyable activities included Scuba Diving with Pure Adventures Puerto Rico (out of Fajardo), kayaking in the bioluminescent bay, and hiking in El Yunque. The beach in front of the hotel is OK. It gets a lot of local traffic and there is some trash on the beach. I'd suggest going a few minutes to the Caribbean side of the island--nicer water and beaches. The Luquillo Sunrise is a diamond in the rough and, like other reviewers note, perfect for use as home base to explore the island.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay at the Luquillo Sunrise, as their name indicates.”
Reviews.Author: busybeemema
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptional. We got to experiance the sunrise on our second day, what a view from our room. The service was great and what a friendly staff. I have to say by all means the friendliest. I have to compliment them on such a great service. I wasnt to thrilled with luquillo though, had more expectations. The hotel and service was deffinately out of this world. I will come back since the local attractions were great. If anyone ever in the area Finca carabali, was great. We went horseback riding and El Yunke, unbelievable a must if in the area. I rate all of these a 10. Any photos upon request of any of these areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place to stay in Luquillo”
Reviews.Author: keesking
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and really enjoyed it. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and everything was delicious. The complimentary use of beach towels and chairs was nice, we used them every day. There is almost nothing else to do in Luquillo, but the beaches were what we came for and they were great. The beach right in front of the Sunrise Beach Inn is a surfing beach but our kids played in the waves with boogie boards and had a blast. The staff was friendly and helpful. The woman who makes and sells her jewelry during the breakfast hours was very knowledgeable about the sea turtles' nesting habits. She also makes lovely jewelry for modest prices. Seven Seas Beach in Fajardo was also a really nice beach and less crowded than the Balneario Luquillo. The beach restaurant at Seven Seas beach had very good food and nice, cold beer. We snorkeled right off the beach there. It wasn't the greatest snorkeling but we saw plenty of fish and our kids loved it. Be sure and do a kayak trip to the bio-bay in Fajardo too, it was amazing. We also ate dinner at Guavas and Lolitas and both were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: 4accord
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Puerto Rico, we had no idea where to stay. We found this wonderful hotel by Net surfing and chose it based on comments from other travelers. We have nothing but positives - great and friendly staff, super location, wonderful breakfast, comfortable room, reasonable rates, Internet access. What more could one ask? Only suggestion: double check your driving directions. It is a little hard to find the first time, and PR is memorable for its lack of road signs and mazes of one-ways and dead ends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the High Points of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: XCtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay a Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was unbelevable, the inn is located right across the street from a beautiful section of beach, at night we could hear the surf all night. Sitting on the balcony was a truely relaxing experience. The Inn was very clean and beautifully decorated. It was hard to leave for our visit to the El Yunque Rain Forest. Breakfast on the Deck was great, so much good food and a very friendly staff just made the stay all the more wonderful. The Inn had beach chairs and wake boards for us to use so for one of our days we never left and just took in the beautiful ocean coast and wonderful water. We only wish we could have stayed for a few more days, but had to return to the real world. We will return to the Inn on our next trip and spend more time there. If you want a truely pleasant experience plan to stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn you will fall in Love with it, I know we did. Hats off to the Staff and Management, you truely have a Gem in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ginmay3304
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Puerto Rico, my (new) husband and I stayed in three different hotels, two of which were resorts. This one was by far our favorite! The location is great, the rooms are clean, the service in incredible and the breakfasts are enjoyable. If you are worried about your limited spanish, don't be. I highly recommend that you stay at Luquillo Sunrise Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: seren327
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon and it was wonderful. It is not a luxury hotel, there is no phone, no internet in most rooms and the bed was not the most comfortable. If you are used to a fancy resort with luxury sheets and every convenience, this place might not be for you. Having said that, I would not stay anywhere else in Puerto Rico. The view from the balcony at sunrise is amazing! Breakfast every morning on the patio overlooking the ocean was great. The staff were amazingly helpful and suggested places to visit, and local places to eat. They booked some day excursions for us (which were also discounted by booking through them). The East Island Flyer tours were a little pricey compared to others but they were great and I would not have done it any other way. Do not miss the Vieques Bio Bay trip which includes dinner - it cost around $100 a person and was worth every penny. If we needed anything, it was taken care of immediately and we were given big beach towels and beach chairs to use during our stay at no charge. There have been many comments here about the neighborhood being bad, but it is just a little run down (like so many other places in PR) and we walked along the beach and also down to Guavas at night and did not feel like it was unsafe. The best food we had on the whole trip was around the corner at the Brass Cactus. Very reasonable prices and wonderful food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous B&B”
Reviews.Author: paddyrags
Reviews.Content: From the time I called them to enquire about reservations until the minute we left the hotel for the airport, the experience was fantastic. Demian, who sits at the front desk and answered the first call, helped shop around for biobay trips before i even booked the reservation! He was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The room was very comfortable and we had a fabulous view of the ocean. I woke up one morning at 5.47am and caught a beautiful sunrise. Since they have only a few rooms, breakfast felt like a cosy family ritual on the terrace. Heidi, Clarence and Minerva made wonderful hot breakfast every morning. (i made it a point to note down their names) One night our A/C stopped workng, and i was about to start grumbling, but they immediately accomodated us for that one night in their best available room and gave us access to both the rooms. There was decent snorkelling nearby. The beach in front of the hotel is slightly away from the big public beach, so it felt more private but just as nice. For those who like Puerto Rican food, there are 60 kioskos near the luquillo beach, a fun experience to walk around and eat here. In general, the whole atmosphere was cosy and fun. We loved our vacation in puerto rico, thanks in no small part to this wonderful little Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Supportive Staff and Homely Stay”
Reviews.Author: lqiclemson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Puerto Rico for a five-day vacation, among which two nights were spent at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. We both agreed that the two nights spent at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn were the best among the five. The staff there was very welcoming. The day we arrived was late at night. And we got lost because the GPS has not yet had the correct map of the town of Luquillo. But once you got off exit Luquillo, you are not far from the Inn. Well, then we called the hotel, the person who attended my call was entirely patient and guided us by phone. Besides the heart-pleasing service, the Inn was set fronting the Luquillo beach, one of the finest in Puerto Rico. The pristine beach view without any commercial interruption embraces your stay all the time, even during the breakfast, because the breakfast is set on the balcony facing the ocean. Try it yourself and see if you would like it as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn was outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: reganstravels
Reviews.Content: The hospitality of the entire staff was outstanding. My husband and I stayed for two days. When we needed directions, we were given verbal directions along with a map. When we asked for suggestions for food, they provided us with a few different options and we were completely satisfied (with price and taste)! The sunrise was phenomenal...can't go wrong with nature! And the breakfast that was included in the room price was above and beyond any B & B could offer!! Thanks for making our last days on your beautiful island unforgettable!! Sincerely, Regan and Marc Caruncho

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: intrepid411
Reviews.Content: Great price, great view, very nice hotel. Great breakfasts on patio, excellent staff. I read some people used the hotel without a car, I wouldn't suggest. Supermarkets, Burger king, Walgreens, subway sandwiches all close by (to drive). Main beach at Luquillo 5 minute drive. Easy drive to rain forrest, don't miss La Mina falls (its a hike). The town the hotel is in is a little beat up. Note: Throw your GPS away, follow the directions on the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Bayamonesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a quite and beautiful place. We enjoyed a wonderful view of the sea from our balcony. It is a very nice place to be relax.

Reviews.Title: “100% Recommended”
Reviews.Author: frauheidekraut
Reviews.Content: The staff were knowledgeable and helpful. They provided excellent maps to suggest local beaches and restaurants, quality beach towels and chairs to use right across the street on the sand. The breakfasts were enjoyable (breakfast burritos, waffles, pancakes, fresh fruits, cereal, oatmeal, bagels) and we enjoyed munching on them while seated on the second story patio looking out into the ocean. The accommodations were clean and well kept, and the location is nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn”
Reviews.Author: Chili1
Reviews.Content: This place is all about a nice view from your balcony...It overlooks a nice, if choppy, stretch of ocean and is a short stroll down the beach from a pretty nice spot to swim and sun yourself. The rooms are clean but not fancy or overly comfortible. The staff was nice and helpful. Breakfast was good and the patio dinning area/lounging area (no pool) was a nice place to sit and plan your day. Loquillo is not really a happening place, however there are decent restaurants nearby, it's near the rainforest, and close enough to San Juan to do the touristy stuff without staying in the touristy area. We spent a couple of nights here, and would recommend it to those who can tolerate the no frills rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LAHLAH_8
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I went for a week for our yearly "bonding" trip. We loved this hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and attractive with a balcony overlooking the sea. We spent many morning hours talking while swinging in the hammock chairs on the big veranda. The breakfasts were excellent. We even had a high-speed connection in our room. Add to all this the very reasonable price. We consider Luquillo Sunrise to be a find and will certainly return sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Eastern Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: pikew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 nights at Luquillo Sunrise resort. This quaint little hotel is in an excellent location. Right across the road from the hotel is a great beach. And if youâ€™re able to drag yourself out of bed early enough, you can see a great sunrise from your balcony. We werenâ€™t able to snorkel in front of the hotel, but the waves made for great entertainment. A great beach for surfing beginners. If you want to snorkel, just take a short walk down the beach to the nearby reef area where the waves arenâ€™t as big. And if you want even calmer waters, itâ€™s not very far to famous Luquillo Beach, just behind the kiosks on Route #3. And within about 15 minutes drive you can get to Bio Bay, beach/snorkeling catamarans, El Yunque rain forest, horse back riding, or a factory outlet mall. The rooms themselves are quite comfortable. Each room above ground level has a balcony which gives an excellent view of the beach area. I canâ€™t speak for the other rooms, but ours (#24) had a microwave, a small refrigerator and satellite television (Dish Network). Thereâ€™s no telephone in the room, but youâ€™re on vacation â€“ no need for one! We also had Wi-fi in our room. There are lots of juices, pastries, fruit, bagels, etc provided for breakfast, as well as a light prepared breakfast, such as scrambled eggs, waffles, and pancakes. It changes each morning. And its delicious. As good as the hotel and its location are, probably the best feature of this hotel is the staff. They are exceptional. I cannot say enough about Sherri, Susie, or Demien, to name just several. They quickly and expertly answered any questions we had about the area, such as where to eat, what to do, etc. And they provided excellent driving directions. They have information about most attractions and restaurants in the area. They even booked our excursions for us and made recommendations. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: erickson106
Reviews.Content: Sunrise Beach Inn was one of the best surprises of the trip! The staff was friendly, very helpful and enjoyable to be around. The hotel itself was in excellent condition and the location can not be beat. Luquillo has some of the best beaches on the east side of the island and the hotel is literally across the street! The prices were well worth it, and the breakfasts were great. I'm still wishing I had eaten more of the French toast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luqillo Sunrise Beach Inn!”
Reviews.Author: dmderstine
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short trip to beautiful Puerto Rico. We thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay at the lovely Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. The staff was very warm and welcoming, and our room was clean and comfortable. The view of the ocean literally across the street was breathtaking. It was a lovely sunrise. The delicious breakfast served on the terrace was an added bonus to our stay--a truly wonderful and relaxing way to start the day! The hotel loaned us beach chairs and nice beach towels for our day at the beach. We would highly recommend this hotel to those traveling to Puerto Rico, and hope that someday we can go back again!

Reviews.Title: “location could be better”
Reviews.Author: paradisebeachbum
Reviews.Content: I gave the Inn four stars because the Inn was clean the staff were friendly and the ocean view was awesome. The breakfasts were very nice and the staff helpful. But, the surrounding area was seedy to say the least. Right next door there are abandoned buildings and low income apartments. This is not somewhere to walk at night. The Inn has security gates that lock up at night for a reason, plus a security guard at night. Bars on the windows are a common site. If this Inn was located somewhere else, safer, cleaner beach, and with an ocean view, that would be great!

Reviews.Title: “Luquillo will see me again”
Reviews.Author: L2Travelwarm
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn. I woke this morning at home in Wisconsin swearing I heard the ocean waves. The Inn was actually recommended to us by our private El Yunque rainforest guide (John Druitt---Highly recommended as well--just google him). Having never stayed in Puerto Rico or near the rainforest I had no idea what to expect. Our expectations were met and exceeded. I have to admit, when we drove through the neighborhood initially, I was a bit hesitant at what we would find for our hotel. It is not part of a long line of beachfront sky rises. There are a few in the area, but not many. At first the neighborhood seems a little questionable--didn't stay long enough to really find out and we really didn't have any problems. The property is well secured with a gate, etc. at night so we felt completely safe. This property lies across the street from Luquillo Beach, but it really doesn't matter, because it feels like you are sitting right on the beach. The patio area is on the second floor and has hammocks and lounge chairs to sit and just listen to the waves crash to the shore. I can still hear them now as I type. The rooms were very clean and well taken care of. Floors were all tile, no carpet. Which seems to be the best anyway for beach front property. The staff was amazingly friendly and knowledgeable about the area, the wildlife, the activities offered, etc. They offered free beach chairs and towels to guests. Boogie boards and snorkel equipment was only $5/half day (I think). Cannned soda/bottlled water was available for $1 each.---very reasonable. We had 3 rooms between 3 couples. Room 24 was on the upper floor and had a private balcony which is always fun. But, the other two rooms 11 and 12 on the bottom floor were of no lesser quality by any means. And they were very convenient for lugging suitcases, etc. I did not notice if the two lower floors had a refrigerator, but 24 did. No blow dryers in rooms, but front desk had them for use. Breakfast in the morning was continental and then a little later french toast was served to order (everyone had the same thing, but it was brought to you fresh not assembly line). They even brought it to us on our lounge chairs....while we overlooked the beach. Now can you beat that? I thought the prices were very reasonable (with tax) $115 for lower and $135 for upper. Our only regret is we didn't plan to stay long enough. We stayed at the end of a cruise and had to head home in less than 24 hours. I would recommend staying at least 2+ nights. You MUST see the rainforest which is just a short journey ---and is visible from near the hotel. Food was available at restuarants around the neighborhood, but not many choices in walking distance. A car would be necessary. Several food stands called "Kiosks" offered options, but again not walking distance. Guavas just one block away was ok. As far as the beach goes, it was a bit choppy the 24 hours we were there, and I get a feeling that is typical due to location. We had a blast body surfing the waves. I'm told the scuba and snorkeling just a little ways away is great. Oh and the sunrise. If you are a morning person---wake by 6:00am just to watch the ball of fire come up over the horizon ove the ocean with palm trees and sand right before your eyes. So amazingly beautiful. We are already planning our next trip to this quaint location. Thanks Luquillo for topping off our vacation and making us want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Inn!”
Reviews.Author: travlfam96
Reviews.Content: The luquillo sunrise inn is a hidden jewel. The staff is excellent going above and beyond to make the stay as enjoyable and restful and fun as you want it to be. The morning breakfasts are great and there is something for everyone. The views of the ocean are awesome! Right across the street only a few steps away!!! unbelievable!! you love your stay and will not regret choosing this b&b.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Luquillo, PR”
Reviews.Author: From5280ToZero
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Luquillo following an afternoon at El Yunque national park and didn't regret it thanks to the Luquillo Sunrise. You can get a great ocean view at a great price and it includes breakfast (continental and a prepared special each day), secure parking, internet access, and as you might guess, a fantastic sunrise! (if you can pry yourself out of bed at 6) Luquillo is not the fanciest, most upscale town on the island, but we felt safe walking down to check out the restaurants (I think we ended up at a place called Seafood King or something like that - best pina coladas we had on our trip oddly enough) We only stayed for one night and just had time to walk down the very windy but picturesque beach before heading out on the road. (I don't think the wind was normal) This is definitely the place to stay if you need something in the area. Inexpensive, clean, every room above the first floor has great ocean views, and within striking distance of El Yunque. Great establishment, I wish you best of luck for many years to come, LSR! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!! loved the oceanfront!!!”
Reviews.Author: s_bhut
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place, great beach, LOVED our stay”
Reviews.Author: starbobcat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and new. We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor with the big balcony. It was nice to here the ocean and see the Ocean while lying in bed. Although any room would be nice I would spend extra for a 2nd or 3rd floor room. The beach is supurb, that is part what makes this such a cool place. There are commons areas, and breakfast is served in open air area (FREE). The staff are all very helpful and pleasent. I would highly recomend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bgrimm25
Reviews.Content: The entire experience was wonderful in every way! My husband & I stayed there 3 nights with my parents. We loved the staff, the (free, made-from-scratch) breakfasts on the outdoor patio overlooking the ocean, the local restaurant reviews & nature sitings posted in a common room. Definitely family friendly down to the fact that they hand out beach towels & boogie boards. The place was immaculate & friendly. Hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, warm, relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: dr_susansmith
Reviews.Content: the owners and staff of Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn really were able to provide the best of both worlds...a tropical vacation while still making their guests feel at home. The Inn is across the street from the Atlantic Ocean (quite a friendly neighbor to have!) which lulled my husband and me to sleep...everything from the freshly prepared hot breakfast on the hotel's outdoor porch to the accommodations the staff made to book activities for us (at reduced prices, nonetheless!) made the experience a true vacation, away from the stress of work. I found it particularly neat to eat breakfast with the owner in the morning to hear about the local hotspots, and it was a great idea to have an 'activity' room where other guests could write down word-of-mouth advice for local specialties to try. Would definitely recommend this experience to anyone looking to head to the Caribbean for a relaxing vacation where you can experience some local culture and just enjoy the weather. A great value for our money... :0)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn! Surpassd my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SuziChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying 7 days at Luquillo Beach Sunrise Inn. After reading on Trip Advisor all the glowing reviews we decided to stay here all 7 days of our trip. I don't regret a second of it. The staff is like family. We loved everyone. I woke up this morning at 6:15, ready to look out my window to see the sun rise over the ocean....but we are home! The hotel was spotless. They even cleaned our balcony windows daily! Breakfast was laid out at 7:30 in the morning, with everything you could want, bagels, toast, oatmeal, fresh fruit, mango juice, coffee, and from 8:00 to 10:00 they serve a hot breakfast of the day. Delicious. Each day was different during our stay. There is a surfing beach across the street with snorkeling and a safer swimming area close by. We never even made it to the famous Luquillo Beach. There is so much to do between the rain forest, snorkeling, sailing, surfing or boogie boarding, bio bay excursions....and just lazing in the room. We didn't turn on the tv once, and the best part was no phone in the room. We loved the bakery in the town square for a cheap and tasty lunch...try the Tripletta sandwich. The pastries and the coffee and expresso are wonderful. The hotel will get you significant discounts on excusions. Make sure to wear your sunblock! For a walk on the wild side call Robin Phillips for a tour of the rain forest that you will never forget. Not for the faint of heart! We will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Luquillo Beach”
Reviews.Author: ponsib
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for two nights during our recent visit to Puerto Rico. They have a gated parking area in front with plenty of space available. The room was clean and the view of the ocean was great. The person who checked us in was very helpful giving us information about the area and restaurants to try. The area directly in front of the property is not the best for swimming because of the riptide. If you walk west 5 minutes there is a protected area better for swimming, especially for kids. However, we did spend time directly in front of the Inn jumping into the waves without a problem. I had a local person come up to me and tell me to be careful because of the tide. They provide complimentary beach towels and chairs for their guest which is very nice. The property is well maintained and they have a recycling area on the lower level. The breakfast was fabulous!! They offer hot breakfast as well as traditional continental. The staff was very friendly and made us feel welcome. They also have a guard watch over the parking area and property overnight. The only thing I would suggest would be to upgrade the mattress/boxsprings. The beds are on the firm side. Otherwise we were very pleased and will stay again when we return to the area. I would recommend taking a walk over to the town square. The church has a beautiful alter with wood carvings that include pelicans. Also, the bakery (panaderia) was a good find for us! You can also pick up Medalla Light (cervesa) to enjoy on the beach. I want to go back..............

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed and Breakfast in Puerto Rico!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow2health
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful gift we found in Luquillo, Puerto Rico. Our intentions were to only stay for 3 days in the Inn, but because we loved staying there, we ended up using the Inn as our homebase and stayed, to our surprise, for like 10 days! The owners treat you like royalty and the service is impeccable! They will do their best to be accomodating because customer service is number one. The breakfast is homemade and fresh and delicious! My husband and I highly recommend this INN for those visiting Puerto Rico, near the rainforest or who need a stop before going to the other islands. The view is beautiful and the weather is awesome! It was home away from home ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: AmyMYK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights while exploring Puerto Rico for a week. This was our favorite lodging. All of the staff were very accommodating. The location was perfect for snorkeling and visiting the rain forest. Breakfast was delicious. Highly recommended. Hint: Guava's is a fun and delicious place for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DRW-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from vacationing in Puerto Rico. We stayed at the marvelous Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn, one of the higher-rated lodgings on Trip Advisor. Our experience supports that rating. The Inn is an easy 45 minute drive from the airport in San Juan and the directions provided on the Innâ€™s website are accurate and easy to follow. Check in was prompt and courteous and we found our room to be clean, spacious, and inviting. Throughout the week, a variety of delicious hot breakfasts were served from 7:30 to 10:00 a.m., allowing us to enjoy a leisurely pace. One of the best things about Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn is its staff. They continuously showed genuine concern for our comfort and wellbeing. (A special thanks is owed to Gary and Damien for jumping in to help with our car repair. That was above and beyond the call of duty.) The maid service was always prompt and thorough. The wait staff was friendly and attentive. The location is fabulous -- literally seconds away from a wonderful beach dotted with picturesque palm trees. There are many ways to enjoy the endless coastline: sit on the balcony in the comfort of a lounger overlooking the ocean, lie on the gloriously un-crowded beach, or stroll along the surf for an entire afternoon. We spent hours one afternoon captivated by pelicans diving in the ocean while we swam nearby. We managed to tear ourselves away from the ocean to visit other nearby attractions that shouldnâ€™t be missed: the Bioluminescent Bay and the El Yunque rain forest. (Make sure you have a detailed and accurate map. Navigating the area can be challenging and youâ€™re likely to run into locals who donâ€™t speak English.) All in all, the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn is a great place to relax at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the tranquility of the inn and the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jazzsammy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the deluxe king suite which was clean, spacious, and had a beatiful ocean view (all rooms have a balcony and view). The staff were welcoming, informative and prepared delcious breakfasts! Luquilo is a great little surfer town with many options for casual dining and take out. The inn is only 30 minutes walking distance from the public beach which has many amenities. We would definitely stay here again as it was a perfect getaway from the big city at an affordable price. Lisa & Jeremy Vancouver, BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sun1234Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little oasis in a great part of the island. It is right on the beach, rooms are spacious and well-kept, staff is very, very nice and helpful. I would highly recommend it to my friends. You have to want to get away from touristy people and tourists though, know that it is out of the way. Its very convenient to drive to San Juan (1 hour to Old San Juan) or to the rainforest (10 minutes). We went to the beach and did those two things. The Wyndam and Conquistador are very close if you want spa or fancy restaurant, but don't want to pay full price for the whole time. Our stay was very relaxing and very beautiful. Lots of good local restaurants around. Walgreens and supermarket just up the way for essentials.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with Luquillo”
Reviews.Author: austinflower
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Puerto Rico but don't necessarily want to stay in the big city of San Juan, Luquillo is the place for you! We didn't want to stay in a big hotel so we searched B & Bs in Luquillo on the internet. We found Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn and decided it was the place for us. The website said each room had a private balcony and a beach view. We thought there had to be a catch. We were absolutely wrong! The Inn was even better then we ever could have imagined. The room was perfect and indeed included a private patio overlooking the ocean! The view of the sunrise coming up over the beach every day was breathtaking, the staff was more than accommodating, and the home cooked breakfasts each day on the terrace were absolutely fabulous! The beach is literally 50 feet away and the El Yunque Rain Forest is about a 10 minute drive (a must see). We fell in love with Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn, the staff, and the beach! I encourage everyone planning a trip to Puerto Rico to try this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “What they say”
Reviews.Author: iraform
Reviews.Content: Not much else to add: Great location across the street from a beach and a short drive from El Yunque; spartan but super-clean rooms; balconies with views to die for; great breakfasts. There's not much near the inn - a bakery, a bodega and a bar frequented by the locals - so you're going to be driving to most places. The beach across the street is fine for surfing; not so much for swimming. But a government-supervised beach is a five-minute drive away, and it's a huge expanse of sand and calm water. Make sure to hit the food kiosks, which are right next to the swimming beach. The mofongo at No. 2 is the best I've ever had, and the pastelillos and tacos at No. 8 were hot and fresh. A Walgreens, a grocery store and a couple of fast-food joints are a five-minute drive from the inn. Nice place to stay for a reasonable price if you want to relax on the beach or hike El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Isy23
Reviews.Content: I recently stay at the Luquillo Inn and had a wonderful experience. The rooms are lovely an big, and it would comfortably sleep 4 people in a twin double bed room. We had a wonderful view of the ocean and it was a pleasure to get up early to see the beautiful Sunrise from our balcony. It surprised me just how many people staying at the hotel would get up at 6am to watch the sunrise. The staff are extremely helpful an friendly and they always went that extra mile for us. They offered that little personal touch which bigger hotel chains completely over look. Rooms are cleaned everyday to the highest standards and fresh. Only thing i would advise any traveller and this would apply to my entire visit to Puerto Rico is you need a car to get round. Cabs are expensive and buses are in frequent and unreliable. The location of the hotel is very residential area and not to far from the marina or El Yunque Rain Forest. I would highly recomend this hotel to everyone visiting Luquillo.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Side of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: alg188
Reviews.Content: This was a pre-cruise destination for my family. We chose Luquillo over San Juan so that we would be away from the crowds, still have a very nice beach, and be close to El Junque. We accomplished our goals. We stayed for two nights/three days and had only good things to say about the Sunrise Beach Inn. We had one plumbing problem which started overnight the first night. We let the front desk know it. We were still on the terrace enjoying a very nice breakfast when we noticed the owner and manager were already in our room checking into the problem. They moved us into another room, on their own, and made the repairs while we were away for the day. They were very apologetic about the problem and need to move to another room, but they did everything they could, so it was not an issue. We always look forward to breakfast being served, since at home it is usually breakfast on the run. So this was a treat! What could be better than breakfast al fresco with the beach and surf just at your feet? Another reason to stay away from San Juan was to experience Puerto Rico more like a native than a tourist. We accomplished this by having each of our lunches and dinners at the "kioskos." The kioskos are like mini-restaurants, all in a row, some in shacks, some regular buildings. They all had tasty local food, which is what we were looking for. In San Juan, we could have eaten at all the American chain restaurants, but then why leave the mainland? Ask for advice at the front desk as to which kioskos to go to. They can tell you based upon what your needs are. Some are more of a bar/party atmosphere, some more for families and quiet, and others are more fast-food like. We had our first Puerto Rican pina coladas at one of the kioskos (don't remember the number) which was recommended by the hotel manager. While the service at the kiosko was not up to par, the food was very good, and the pina colado went down very well! Muy Buenas Dias.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay for us”
Reviews.Author: Merpeople
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the real PR this place is great, The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating, the breakfasts on the terrace overlooking the ocean were great. Clean rooms, convenient location to all eastern PR attractions (bioluminescent lagoon, El Yunque rainforest, ferries to Culebra and Vieques. We definitely recommend having a car here. This is not for everybody. If you want the "all inclusive" experience where everything is on the premises, this isn't it. But if you like to explore on your own, and come back to a room overlooking the ocean, and fall asleep to the sound of the waves crashing a few yards away, it's perfect. Very reasonable rates. The beach in front of the hotel is not a swimming beach, but great for surfers. There are good beaches for swimming within walking distance. The town of Luquillo is a quaint little village, but not much to do there. We enjoyed sitting out on the plaza across from the church on Sunday morning and listening to the latin flavor hymns sung with a full band. A couple of good restaurants. We ate at the Guavas, a new place that is a few steps down the beach, and the food was outstanding. We had a hard time finding anyplace to dance (Salsa/Merengue) anywhere, (even in San Juan), but finally were directed by one of the locals to El Rancho, which is a roadhouse about 3 miles west on rt 3 (eastbound side). It's a local hangout, definitely not a tourist joint, and you need to speak at least a little spanish to order a drink, but it seemed friendly and safe. We had a great time there. We liked the local brew, Medalla Light, about a buck and a half. Live music Fri/Sat. The Kioskos, a row of stands in front of Luquillo public beach right on rt3 have a variety of local food, cheap, $7-8 for a nice lunch, including beer. We liked Mamacitas, and one other place we can't remember the name. Also La Parilla is highly recommended but we never made it there. Look for the places that seem cleaner and the food is probably better. Again, not everyone speaks english. The public beach is kind of dirty and not very appealing, About halfway between the hotel and the public beach is a nice spot to watch the sunset. All in all, we will DEFINITELY stay here again anytime we come to Eastern PR, WE LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: shatawkwa
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, right across the street from the beach. All the rooms have beachside terraces, and the staff is super friendly and helpful. And the breakfast is great. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Garnacha11
Reviews.Content: My stay was peaceful and quiet. The beach was beautiful, but February is a tough time to actually spend time in the water (unless you have a wet suit). I enjoyed the view from my balcony, and listened to the wind in the trees and the waves crashing on the sand. The room was simple and spotless. The common areas were inviting and the breakfasts were very good. The only downside was that my room had a shower stall rather than a full bathtub. The location was great for hiking excursions in El Yunque.

Reviews.Title: “Truth in Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: Cogata34
Reviews.Content: The name says it all! You can actually watch the sunrise from your bed! But, I think the greatest asset is the staff. Everyone that works there is extremely friendly and helpful. This was the fourth and last place I stayed in Puerto Rico and it was by far the friendliest and least expensive. The rooms are clean, well decorated and extremely comfortable. The breakfast is quite a spread and everyone who stayed there & worked there made it an enjoyable experience each morning on the balcony overlooking the ocean. One of the best areas to walk the beach with diverse ocean front going from surfing to forested areas to sunbathing at the balneario all with views of the crystal clear sea and El Yunque in the distance. I would definitely stay here again and look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Economical Inn”
Reviews.Author: sandrsun
Reviews.Content: We recently spent several days at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn prior to a cruise leaving from San Juan. It is a short drive from San Juan and a world away from the city, a wonderful little Inn overlooking the ocean. Although we were not able to stay in a balcony room our room was very comfortable with all amenties and just steps away from the gated parking area. Excellent breakfasts were served on the upstrairs covered deck area with a gorgeous view of the ocean to start the day. We utilized the guest computer in the common room and spent some time in the hammock chairs on the deck just relaxing. The front office staff was excellent and arranged excursions to the Bio Bay (really fun, we were lazy and took the motorized tour )and also a catamaran trip to Culebra to snorkel and walk the beach. It was also great that the Inn provided beach towels and beach chairs for us to take to Luquillo Beach. The owners of the Inn and their staff were friendly and accommodating. We highly recommend this pleasant Inn to all . Fran & Steve Anderson Foristell, MO

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Dossy60
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Room was clean and roomy. Oceanview was spectacular....and breakfast was fantastic.....staff was friendly and helpful...gave us beach towels and chairs to use during our stay......centrally located...close to Luquillo Beach, El Yunque Rain forest and Fajardo....... .Would definitely recommend. Doris & John Rios, Bergenfield, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pearldiver
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with balcony overlooking the beach. Great views!! Nice clean room, good full breakfast in the morning and very good service all around from booking the room to checking it to breakfast servers etc. I'll be back on my next trip to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in Luquillo!”
Reviews.Author: elin46
Reviews.Content: We booked the 2 bedroom apartment, and found it well furnished, comfortable and clean. There were so many nice local restaurants that we seldom did our own cooking, however. The included breakfasts were delicious, and nicely served, in the upstairs patio. Our friend had the handicap accessible room, and found it very well suited for him, very convenient to our parking spot. The Inn was close to local attractions, and we were provided with good directions to find it, even though our flight was delayed and we arrived in the dark. The staff were very friendly and helpful with booking dinners, and a trip to Los Cabezos de San Juan. We highly recommend the new restaurant a block away ("Guava") and the "Brass Cactus," as well as the "Las Vegas" restaurant near the entrance to El Yunque National Forest. The only "down" side for me was the constant sound of the surf, so it wasn't as quiet as I'd hoped.

Reviews.Title: “A great time in Luquillo PR”
Reviews.Author: ssgBronxNY
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel. The location was fantastic, less than 15 minutes from El Yunque and ten minutes from Luquillo Beach (while the hotel is right on the ocean it faces a windy side good for boogie boarding but not as good for regular swimming). The room was large and comfortable for two adults and two teenagers who are used to sharing a room. The balcony gave us a great view of the lunar eclipse over the ocean. The service could not be better. In addition to a terrific hot breakfast each day, there were books of visitor reviews of restaurants and attractions. We were able to check out towels and beach chairs-- for free-- and snorkeling equipment for $5 a day. The other guests were friendly and took pains to point out the two-foot iguana lounging on a palm tree in the back yard. We had a great base for exploring El Yunque, horseback riding, and Luquillo Beach for two days. It was just lovely and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Beach Front B&B”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter5000
Reviews.Content: My husband an I just got back from our week in PR at the Luquillo Sunrise and all I can do is rave about it. Our king standard room was more than adequate for the both of us size wise. The property was very clean and quiet. Our balcony overlooked the ocean across the street and because we were on the third floor we left our sliding door open every minute we were in the room. The staff was so nice and helpful and most spoke very clear English. The breakfasts were great out on their patio featuring a hot meal choice a wide assortment of continental items. all was fresh and delicious! the people at Luquillo really do want to make your stay in PR the best. They have a wonderful area with internet and info about what is available to do on the island. They also have notebooks written by the guest with their recommendations on what is fun to do, and where the best places to eat are among other things--these are really helpful. It is really just a great place with a wonderful attitude. Great for families just minutes from the state beach. We were throughly impressed and if we make it back to PR we would stay there again. Recommending it to all our friends who need a little sun in Feb.

Reviews.Title: “Great and affordable”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: This place was exactly what was expected. It was an affordable, clean, well-maintained retreat. Do not expect anything fancy or full service. But do expect a quiet and relaxing time. All rooms have an ocean view that is wonderful and you are a short walk from the official Luquillo beach. There is also a great sun deck where you can sit back and relax. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. They give you a nice packet at check-in to help guide you through the areas. Try Guavas for an evening drink (2 minute walk) and you must eat at La Parilla kiosko #3. The food there is unbelievable--service is terrible but worth the wait. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great start”
Reviews.Author: James_St_Paul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had connecting flight troubles and checked in quite late -not a problem at Luquillo. We needed to spend some time the next day researching Fajardo-area attractions on the Internet and making reservations, not a problem with the available kiosk PC. While we did this, we were hungry. Again, not a problem with the complimentary cooked breakfast and continental fruit and pastries available. The view from the breakfast patio and entire ocean side is great. The owner and care-takers are very helpful and friendly; the rooms were clean, tidy and offered everything we needed. The room rates were very competitive as well. We'll stay here again if/when we come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location for diverse Puerto Rican Experience”
Reviews.Author: paletexan
Reviews.Content: This bed and breakfast is very charming, and overlooks the ocean on the north shore of Puerto Rico in the quiet town of Luquillo. The rooms are very clean are recently remodeled. Rooms overlook the ocean and have digital cable if you require that. The hot breakfast is mediocre, but the experience of talking to the staff and other guests is worthwhile. We recommend going to a bakery across from the town square for a local breakfast; and visit the nearby Kiosks for local fare at lunch/dinner. The staff is very friendly and happy to share tips with travelers as common with most bed and breakfasts. They also helped book tours; and gave tips of things to do and places to eat. Things to do nearby include a bio bay; and El Yunque Rain Forest. Both are worth seeing. Beyond that, we did not find much else in terms of activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JamieLWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Luquillo sunrise. The Inn was right across the road from a great beach. You could walk forever in either direction. The sunrises were beautiful. Our room on the 3rd floor was great. We had a balcony and everything was very clean. My only complaint was the bed, very hard and squeaky. We were minutes away from Fajaro, El Yunque, and the Nature reserve. We went to El Yunque, the Nature reserve (make reservations before you leave home), Vieques, and the bioluminescent bay. We recommend all of them. We booked the Bio Bay tour through the inn. We also took surfing lessons with Bobby. Very fun and affordable. The breakfasts at the inn were the best, enough variety for everyone and good coffee also.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great place”
Reviews.Author: jrags0951
Reviews.Content: We were driving from San Juan and happened to drive by and they had a vacancy. At $105 per night, we took it. Boy were we in for a surprise. This was the nicest place we stayed in Puerto Rico. The rooms were newly redone, the staff was marvelous, and the french toast they made us for breakfast was perfect. The owners told us they bought the inn about a year ago and it was truly evident they are passionate about this little 15 room inn. They are right there on the beach and our only complaint is we aren't there now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Clean and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: SAMAID
Reviews.Content: What a great staff. Super friendly, helpful and knowledgable. Staying in Luquillo is about one thing only -- location - 5 minutes via car to the most beautiful beach in puerto rico (granted there is also a great beach right across the street - a 30 sec walk). 10 minutes to El Yunque the rainforest (the only one in the US) and 15 minutes to the Bio Bay (which we went to on a full moon and had a great time). Which is why we stayed. We didn't go for the town's atmosphere. Luquillo itself is a pit (bordering on slum) so do not be freaked out by the appearance of the town when driving in. The hotel is totally safe and secure. Rooms are spacious and very clean. They give you towels and beach chairs for free and rent snorkeling and boards for $5 day. The breakfasts are included and are excellent. The staff answere every question we had and made excellent recommendations. Kiosk #2 for dinner is amazing. Luquillo Sunrise is a great place to stay especially if you are looking for a reasonably priced alternative to El Conq and Rio Mar - both of which we have stayed at and didn't find either worth the exorbiant prices (especially during the holiday season).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View and Friendly Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GoneTravelin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after a cruise. The location was perfect and the view from our room was fantastic. We felt that we were in the real Puerto Rico. We were a very short walk - less than two blocks - from the main square of Luquillo. We had lunch one day at the bakery on the square, which was excellent. We also had dinner one evening at King's Seafood Restaurant in Luquillo - excellent food and authentic Puerto Rico environment. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly - providing maps and directions in response to all of our questions. On our last morning, we needed to leave early for the airport, planning to grab a quick continental breakfast, before the hours for their full breakfast service. The staff insisted on fixing the hot breakfast of the day for us, even though we arrived over a half hour early planning to have just their continental breakfast. As others have said, Luquillo has an excellent beach which is a very short drive from this inn. There is also a surfing beach directly across from this hotel. Beach chairs and towels are provided by the inn. The location is very close to El Yunque Rainforest - don't miss this fantastic national forest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mig1619
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are going to stay in the East side of Puerto Rico. The location is Excellent, a great surfing beach is in walking distance and the blue flag beach (Balneario de Luquillo) is just 5 minutes distance by car. They are also near the Puerto Rico national rain forest (El Yunque) and the Luquillo Kiosk (kiokos) that have great sea food and a relaxing and cool night life. The service was great and the different hot breakfast every morning is a great change from the traditional continental breakfast. if you want a good, cozy place with great service the Luquillo Sunrise Beach inn is for you. Sincerely; Miguel Vazquez

Reviews.Title: “A very good address”
Reviews.Author: Phil99Paris_France
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights and received a warm welcome, a nice and clean room, helpful advice, a very pleasant view. All the staff is very pleasant and they do try to help in every way. Luquillo itself is a small place, but you do have a car and do not have to drive far to get to things. Eat at the Tres Lolitas for good mexican food and try a few kiosks, shop at Belz outlets, drive along the coast...If you need more urban stuff, Carolina and San Juan are not so far ! I recommend this address, as long as I get a free room when I need it !!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: schuybaby
Reviews.Content: The Inn is right across the street from a surfing (not swimming) beach (you can walk to a safe beach for swimming 20 min. away, or drive 2 minutes.) The Inn is a new property, and the rooms were spotless and comfortable. Every room has an ocean view, and private balcony with chairs. The property is not "beautiful," but well maintained and quiet. The breakfast was good with a lot of choices. The best part was the amount of helpful information they have collected in books, and written guest comments that will help you plan your stay. They have restaurant books, as well as activity ideas, pamphlets and advice. This is one of the cleanest, friendliest places on the island. I will definitely stay here again, but there is not a lot going on in the area in early-November. Many restaurants were closed, and you definitely have to drive to them. There is not a lot of touristy-related things in the area, but this is the real Puerto Rico, not an all-inclusive resort. Two things to change: I would have liked a mini-fridge in the room; the outdoor tiles were very slippery and dangerous when it rained..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, view, staff, and value”
Reviews.Author: Exurbanite
Reviews.Content: Everything said in the previous reviews about the hotel is true - it is very clean and attractive, the staff is amazing, and the view is gorgeous. I would say that the rooms are about the equivalent to a 3.5 star hotel, and the breakfast in the morning is really delicious - all fresh made to order; no cookie cutter buffets here. The owners, Gary and Marcia, care very much about the hotel and their guests, and are constantly working to improve the property. The week we were there they were personally sweating it out in the garden, planting new flowers and doing general clean up. Their love for the hotel is evident in all the many details. They would do anything for their guests. The rooms are exceptionally clean, nicely furnished, and have lovely bedspreads all personally selected by the owner's wife. Each room has a balcony overlooking the ocean, and you can open the doors and listen to the ocean at night. There is free internet too, and secure, gated parking on site. All kinds of travel information is available from the hotel staff and they will help you book tours and plan your excursions on the island. They really know a lot about which tours are best and won't steer you wrong. I have to compliment the housekeeping staff; they are very trustworthy. One morning I accidentally left my credit card and cash sitting on the night stand while I was having breakfast, and when I came back, the room had been cleaned already and the cash and credit card were still right where I left them. Now that's honesty! I was told by the owners that they drug test every staff member, so they are very careful not to get people who might steal or cause other problems. (Theft is a big problem in Puerto Rico - don't leave anything unattended anywhere, including the beach, your car, or your purse in a restaurant.) The location in Luquillo beach is perfect - right across the street from the ocean, with a gorgeous view. Only thing about Luquillo Beach is that the properties surrounding this hotel are all kind of ghetto-ish - the hotel is the nicest property in the area. Also, there are tons of stray dogs everywhere, including on the beach - some are quite sorry looking and not in good health. And there are some homeless people and winos wandering about. So if you are looking for an upscale neighborhood, this is not it. But if you simply want a nice place to stay, and a convenient jumping off point to other attractions in Puerto Rico, then the Luquillo Sunrise is definitely it. Can't say enough good things about Damian, the staff, the hotel, and the great breakfasts. And oh, that view.....

Reviews.Title: “We want to go back.”
Reviews.Author: never2oldNorthwest
Reviews.Content: Everything about this experience was positive. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable, our view was fantastic, and the included breakfast was awsome every morning. The beach across the street was beautiful and we were within easy walking distance of other great beaches. We spent time talking to the owner who was extremely pleasant and helpful in helping us plan our activities. The only negative was that we only booked for three nights. The next time we get to PR we will plan on at least a week at the Luquillo Sunrise Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new guest house on Luquilla Beach”
Reviews.Author: svillusions
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, quiet hotel on a beautiful beach, this is the place for you. The rooms were immaculately clean and neat, everything new. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The view is to die for. The balcony where a wonderful breakfast is served (included in the price of the room) has a beautiful view of the beach which is only steps away. Each room has a small private balcony overlooking the beach. I will definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: goofcat
Reviews.Content: This B&B was exceptionally priced for the location, comfort, amenities, and breakfast. The staff was extremely helpful as well. The views off the balcony were beautiful...nothing like the moonlight glistening on the ocean. Luquillo was the perfect jumping off point for activities in San Juan, El Yunque, and Fajardo. Would definitely recommend and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Luquillo Sunrise Inn great value, superb view, clean rooms, yummy breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: danora78
Reviews.Content: The hotel was superb. Breakfasts in the mornings are a highlight (Tropical pancakes were so good that syrup was not needed) Rooms were clean and comfortable. Not a stuffy resort, but the staff treats you like family. Susy was so accomadating - She set up a massage for my wife on the balcony and followed up on my reservations for activities when they were rained out. Also, Damian was very helpful and friendly. The beach is clean, beautiful and swimable - It was choppy for us during our stay, but lots of fun fighting the waves. I would recommend the balneario publico for families with small children (5 minutes away and so calm) . Damian reccommended Kiosko #2 "La Parilla". This place was soo good and looks out to the beach. The Kioskos look scary, but are definitely ok. La Parilla, though, is the cream of the crop. If you are looking for a good restaurant, go to "Las Vegas" which is on the road to el Yunque only about 15 minutes away. Very classy fine dinning restaurant with awesome cuisine. (My wife's a flan expert and said the homemade flan and ice cream -called mantecado- were the best ever).

Reviews.Title: “great place, great people, great view, great bfasts”
Reviews.Author: Wondcerland
Reviews.Content: This is a jewel on the east side of the island. Not a stuffy hotel, not a dumpy little place, this place shines. Very clean, tiled throughout, spacious view of the dramatic beach, helpful and friendly staff. It s 20 miles from the airport, close to the Yunque. Luquillo itself does not have much and the neighborhood has seen better days,but the beach is great and the location is convenient. dont even think of staying in fajardo=nothing there anymore excpt the ferry and few exclusive overpriced isolated resorts

Reviews.Title: “Sunrise spectacular”
Reviews.Author: deerslayer55
Reviews.Content: Found this site on the internet. Simply gorgeous deserted beaches, excellent breakfast, marvelous hosts, spacious room with a private porch. We slept all night to the sound of the waves. Very peaceful. Location is superb to travel to the El Yunque Rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with great view”
Reviews.Author: billfish4u
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of places within 45 minutes of San Juan but you will not find a more resonable price for what you get. You get a very clean, great view of the ocean with the beach 50 yards away. They also give you a really good free breakfest. We will be staying there when in Puert Rico every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at Luquillo Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: varipaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn in October, 2007. The hotel is new, but we stayed in the apartment in front of the hotel. The apartment is about 40 years old and shows signs of wear, but the porch is is the best location of the hotel, overlooking the ocean. The area is fairly rundown, but that's not unusual for Puerto Rico where you will often see a nice hotel right next to rundown buildings. The breakfasts were great, on an upstairs, open air rooftop overlooking the ocean. A full buffet of typical continental breakfast, plus a hot entree that changed every day (french toast, scrambled eggs, breakfast burritos). Everyone on the staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel is separated from the ocean by a road, but not a busy one. There was some glass by the road, but once you were on the beach it was clean. The waves were pretty high, which we liked, but if you want a calm beach, you can walk to Luquillo Beach about 20 minutes walking by beach. We walked via beach to the kioskos for lunch, about a 45 minute walk. Great lunch at kiosko #2 (La Parilla), but can be expensive ($20+ for an entree). We chose to have several appetizers instead. We ate dinner another night at #9 (Conga), we enjoyed that even more and was not quite as much. The hotel is a convenient location for visiting El Yunque -- only a short drive from the hotel. There is not really a shopping area to walk to from the hotel, but there is a grocery store, Walgreens, pizza place and Mexican restaurant just a short drive across Hwy 3. Can't say anything about the Mexican restaurant; the pizza was good, but it is really for take out or delivery (they have tables, but the ambience is like a Dominos). The management at the hotel was excellent -- always assisting with directions, recommendations and anything else we asked. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “sun,beach and surf”
Reviews.Author: boriqua46
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice quite clean place without paying 5 stars prices this is the place. The rooms are airy and very clean and are beach front. The staff all speak english and are very helpful. The beach is beautiful but its a surf or boogie board beach. My husband and I are into body surffing so we loved it. There are sand dollars to be found. Unfortunately you do need to rent a car. The only good walking distance eatery is the Flamboyan which is like a bar and grill great for lunch and beer. The people who hang around the Flamboyan are all very friendly and helpful.This beautiful beach front country inn is ideal for adults without children or for families who are on there way to the rain forest. Loved it would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sassy2001
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small personable and yet convenient place to stay this is a great place. Room was very clean with an excellent view of the ocean. When we arrived we were given a lot of information about the area including maps and places of interest which was very helpful. I will definetly stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bed & Breakfast Inn”
Reviews.Author: dsantana57
Reviews.Content: The Inn is centrally located in Luquillo only 10-15 mins away from major attractions (El Yunque, Ferries to Vieques, Fajardo Fishing Town, and much more). The Inn is just steps away from the beach which was very clean and very quiet. There are local stores and restaurants within a 5 min walk. The Inn itself is very new (just opened in Jan '07). It is very nicely decorated, very clean, and the rooms are very roomy and comfortable with beautiful view of the ocean (fantastic sunrise). The daily breakfast (continental and cooked) is simple but yet delicious. Everyday was a different hot breakfast. The staff was absolutely wonderful! They were very friendly, knowledgeable, and accomodating to our needs. They offer all types of excursions and offer great discounts to their guests. We will definitely stay at this Inn on our next visit to Luquillo, PR!! We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: Fluffybunny6702
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel on the beach with great staff. Rooms are clean and spacious. Location is great. We drove from Old San Juan quite easily. Great breakfast at the hotel. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Very close to Luquillo beach, though we found the beach right across from the hotel to be much less crowded.
