Hotel gives you beach towels to use and rents snorkel gear for the day. Easy drive to Fajardo where you can get the ferries to Culebra and Vieques. Also easy to get to El Yunque from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: bfdummis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 days in September. The lack of street signs made finding the hotel a real challenge, but the staff 'talked us in' over the phone with no problem. Once we knew where the place was we had no trouble find our way around, although one way streets (marked and un-marked) made things interesting. The rooms are clean and in great shape. Everything works. There are no phones in the rooms, but our US cell phones worked just fine so that was not an issue. There is cable tv, but no ESPN or movie channels. The ESPN thing is a big issue for me, especially during college football season. We spent Saturday evening at the Brass Cactus for dinner so I could catch up on game scores. There is no refrigerator in the room, and ice doesn't last long, so we got use to room temperature drinks. Not a big deal, but worth noting. The staff hooked us up with a day of scuba diving and a day of snorkeling on the catamaran Spread Eagle II. Both were great experiences. We paid less than everyone else on both trips by booking the excursions through the hotel. I actually saw the manifest on the Spread Eagle II, and we each paid $15 less than everyone else. The restaurant recomendations made by the staff were accurate and helpful. The included breakfasts were much better than the usual 'complimentary breakfast' you get these days. We had a great experience and would be happy to stay there again. -KF & MV Rochester Hills, MI

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Secure with a memorable view”
Reviews.Author: ccrunner714
Reviews.Content: Small Inn with very clean,secure rooms with an unforgettable view of the ocean. A very generous and tasty breakfast comes included. Staff is very knowledgeable and helpful with any questions you might have concerning sites or directions. Beach right across the street from inn. Would highly recommend staying here, I know we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Gizmoo
Reviews.Content: It would have been Excellent, except for the low water pressure in the shower. Great people running the hotel, very hekpful, and a great view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night at Luquillo Sunrise”
Reviews.Author: bilawing
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful one-night stay. We were spoiled by receiving an upgrade to their apartment, but even without the upgrade, we would have given a great review. As an oceanfront resort (across the street, barely), it is a very friendly place. There is wireless along with a free available computer. Breakfasts are personalized and are good meals. We were all over the island, and Luquillo Sunrise was one of our best experiences. The only drawback is the fact that the town has little to offer, but the location is very close to so many great options. We will stay there again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “close to sail/snorkle/kayak activities”
Reviews.Author: maplover
Reviews.Content: we like staying in a neighborhood that has character vs. a high rise in the urban center. sunrise inn was a nice spot to return to every day after nearby water activities. the hammock out back is very accessible, as are free beach towels/chairs. having internet in the mezzanine is handy in case you need to retrieve a travel plan or something. and we appreciate them saving our phone charger for us that we left behind. and its true, black bean soup at metropol is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: jtemplet
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our one week trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn for three nights. It is in a perfect location, just across the narrow street from the beach, and just a few miles from Fajardo's marinas and El Yunque. We paid $105 plus tax for a Queen bed room with a private balcony overlooking the ocean. The price includes a cooked breakfast, (served on a lovely terrace that also overlooks the water), beach towels and chairs. The staff were friendly and very helpful: organizing our excursions (Culebra Island snorkeling and Bioluminescent Bay kayaking) and providing a first aid kit for a minor injury. The beach is lovely, with a completely undeveloped stretch to the east, where turtles nest! A couple of minor comments: There are no good restaurants within walking distance (someone should open one nearby!). There are also no hairdryers in the rooms, so bring your own (I did). They might supply one at the desk though.

Reviews.Title: “The Sunrise Beach Inn was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: jasonbolden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn for 6 days as we trekked about the area. The hotel itself is ordinary. The view from the balcony is extraordinary. However, they should add bar stools, because the balcony line obstructs your view once you sit down. Every morning they have a nice fruit collection, grapes, grapefruit, kiwi, bananas, apples, mango, etc. Toast, bagel, jams, juice, coffee, etc. and a hot meal too, which ranged from breakfast burritos to pancakes to french toast. Nothing fancy but prepares you nicely for the day. The beach across the street is spectacular and a second beach down the street, a two minute drive or long walk, is ideal. From this location we snorkelled, kayaked in the biolumenescent bay, hike the El Yungue rainforest, drove a good drive to the Caves of Camuy and just enjoyed the beach. Damien and Suzy are very helpful. If there is anything you want, they're willing to help make it happen. You would not find more helpful service at a Ritz Carlton. There is a little beach shower just off the edge of the parking lot, which is gated, to help keep sand out of the hotel room. We had read a few comments about property crimes before we got there. However, we never once encountered anything suspicious whatsoever. We walked along the beach at night and never gave it a second thought. The snorkelling excursion was our favorite via the Spread Eagle II, recommended by the hotel staff. The hotel staff provides a list of local restaurants that they recommend and over the course of 6 days we tried nearly all of them. Kings was my wife's favorite. Metropol was my favorite. Neither of us cared for Sandy's. Everything is was very nice. We would certainly stay there again. We loved our experience and if we ever return to Puerto Rico, we will likely return to this hotel. Jason Bolden Little Rock, Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “would stay at Luquillo sunrise again”
Reviews.Author: MPM_chicago
Reviews.Content: New facility built in Jan 2007. Clean, beautiful view of the ocean, easy access across a quiet street. The folks running it, Suzy and Damien are so helpful and the beach towels and chairs are terrific. Nice breakfast in the AM. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: krollc1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Luquillo Sunrise. The room was very comfortable and clean with a wonderful view of the ocean from our balcony. The furniture was very nice and complete and the bathroom was roomy. The breakfasts are out on a wonderful terrace overlooking the beach. The food included a hot entree and wonderful varieties of fruit, pasteries, juice and coffee. We took a wonderful walk on the beach to the right of the hotel and walked for hours without seeing anyone else. We were looking for baby turtles but only saw lots of turtle nests. The birdwatching was excellent. A river flows into the ocean and attracts lots of wildlife. The rainforest is a very short drive away and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “terriffic view!”
Reviews.Author: poppa13
Reviews.Content: great view! great breakfast! pretty good price ! cant go wrong .

Reviews.Title: “Luquillo Sunrise is the way to go when staying in Luquillo.”
Reviews.Author: eleutherio78
Reviews.Content: The place is great. Although it doenst have a pool you can throw a rock into the ocean from the front gate, you are that close. Although luquillo is a bit "rough around the edges", this place and people all around make it a great place to visit. There really isnt much to do at the hotel, but all around you got places and things to see and do. Tips: Visit the bar on the same street as luquillo, on the weekend the locals race their horses on the street. Listen to their advice on what and where to go... They definetly dont stray you wrong. BTW there's bigger hotels to stay at but this place seemed to be more centrally located and offered great service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DcVeggiemel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn recently with a large group, attending a destination wedding. We had a wonderful time, and were more than satisfied with the accommodations. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The air conditioner and fan in the room provided plenty of cool escape from the hot sun, but there was almost always a wonderful breeze from the ocean. Our room had a fabulous view of the ocean which was directly across the street, with nothing to block our view. There was a large Iguana sleeping in a beautiful large palm tree outside the room, as well as a few hammocks outside which we took advantage of. There was a warm breakfast each morning, along with continental selections. It was consistently delicious, and served with a smile. There was a large patio for hanging out with the rest of our group and enjoying the view. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend this hotel highly to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: pulawyliz
Reviews.Content: A great guest house right on Luquillo Beach just east of San Juan Puerto Rico. Each room has a small balcony with a view of the ocean.The owners were extremely accommodating to the guests and a real breakfast was served on the patio each morning. Parking is secured for no extra price. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It is a little hard to find as you ramble down winding streets in Luquillo Beach but worth the effort. Just don't book when a wedding is going on! It was noisy all night. A plus is that the inn is very close to Yunque Rain Forest( a must see) and an easy day trip from the inn. It would be a good family spot as well with easy beach access .

Reviews.Title: “Trust the good reviews!”
Reviews.Author: nwish
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico, and the Luquillo Sunrise was our jumping-off point. All of the good reviews about this inn are right on target. They make you feel welcome, the furnishings are comfortable, the location on the beach is perfect and the service is warm. We arrived two hours early and were allowed to check right in. The best part was being able to sleep with the air conditioning off, the windows open, and the sound of the surf the only thing we heard. We enjoyed talking with the owners at breakfast, and plan to check out their other location in Pennsylvania. All in all, a lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for your trip”
Reviews.Author: WillRose
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here after reading reviews on this site, which goes to show how useful these reviews can be! The staff are helpful and friendly, the guesthouse is clean, tidy, very comfortable and well equipped for the price. I only stayed here three nights while travelling through Puerto Rico but i would have liked to have stayed longer and seen some attractions in the region. Luquillo offers you great beaches but you need a car to visit other attractions. I reccomend staying here especially becuase it allows you to travel around eastern Puerto Rico without having to fight the traffic of San Juan, and you have one of the best beaches on your door step every day. I spoke to a couple on luquillo beach who were paying 3 times as much to stay in San Juan only to drive out to Luquillo to find a peaceful beach. I also had a surf lesson with a local instructor and walked for miles in both directions on seemingly empty and endless sandy beaches.
